story:
If you get sick, is it from the water you drank? The food you ate? Did you catch something from your neighbor? To know what’s going on in your life you must get a better look inside yourself but also know what’s going on around you. Just imagine what life would be like if you could avoid getting sick, or diagnose disease before it made you sick.....

We are the Distributed Health Labs, based at the Qualcomm Institute, which is the UC San Diego division of the California Institute for Telecommunications and Information Technology. Our mission is to enable OASIS, the most powerful sensor network on the planet.

Together, devices, connected users and machine intelligence create a "crowd-doctor", which gets smarter and better the more people use it. OASIS will empower citizens (YOU) to sense more about your health and environment, producing data that can be shared on a living map of the things that matter to us all. 

How It Works


1. A sensor measures your vitals just by touching you.  Another sensor analyzes liquids, such as water or blood, for things that shouldn’t be there. 

2. The data goes to your smartphone, which displays measurements and provides a diagnosis.

3. Certain kinds of data can be shared, helping the system get better at creating a living map for our health. This data gets fed back to you to make your OASIS device work better and give you practical health information. 

Through low-cost sensors, OASIS lets us monitor the aspects of our health and surroundings that we cannot see. By keeping costs down and building an open yet highly secure 'cloud' platform, we can connect the data from these sensors in ways that preserves users privacy but allows us to better determine illness or environmental threats at home and around the globe.


We’ve built prototype optical and electrochemical sensors that are almost ready for the field. Our vitals monitor is nearly complete and ready for calibration. When ready it will measure temperature, heart rate, pulse oxygen, breathing and maybe even blood pressure. The key to making this really work will be calibration in the field, by our users. 


Our electrochemical sensors will first be used to identify heavy metals in water, but updated test-strips will detect nearly any type of communicable or medical disease. We will be calibrating and evolving our technology through crowd sourcing the data collection to you.

Why both health and environment? Simple. Our personal health is inextricably linked to our environment AND we can measure both with the same technology! Download my.Oasis, our beta-app for reporting pollution and diseases on the Apple App Store. we’ll be updating the app for health soon.

It is our goal to enable a network of 1,000,000 citizen-sensors by 2017, starting with 1,000 devices and 10,000 apps deployed by 2015. 

This campaign is the driving force behind what will get us there. We want YOU to enable one of those sensors. That's why we've turned to Indiegogo and you. Read more about our work, and we hope you'll support at whichever level you can!

We Need Your Support

We need your help to finish building and deploying the Open Health Stack, the infrastructure necessary to make OASIS possible. We are close to finishing our SENSE prototypes but we need money to help manufacture and distribute these devices in Mongolia, Mozambique, Mexico, Haiti and the U.S. There are several ways you can help:

  1. Please make a tax-deductible donation!
  2. Help us share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter
  3. Tell all your friends!

We have turned to the crowd because "citizen sensing" depends on a community of users, and with your support we can get the critically needed resources to complete our sensors and expand our user community at the same time. 

WE HOPE YOU WILL JOIN OUR CITIZEN SENSOR NETWORK!!!

NOTE: Building any kind of hardware sensor is difficult work.  We want to make it clear that the device you are receiving from our campaign is a prototype and not what many would consider a polished, finished product.  Keep in mind that we are university research laboratory, not a for-profit business. However, we promise that any prototypes we ship will be functional, making you part of a global citizen sensing network!

Read More about our project and technologies..........


Open Tech

We call our tech the “Open Health Stack” a collection of open and inexpensive tools to diagnose, report and visualize health and environmental disease around the world. The driving force behind our stack is SENSE.

[SENSE: A low-cost Tricorder for the globe. SENSE is like the medical “tricorder” from Star Trek, a futuristic health monitor. Ours contains two components. The optical and electronic sensor array lets you measure vital data such as  temperature, heart rate and oxygen levels. The electrochemical sensor (potentiostat) works with cheap, glucometer-like, disposable strips to measure environmental pollutants, human and even animal diseases.

The technology behind our devices is tried and true; we’re just making it cheaper, better and putting it together so anyone can use it. While components of our tech are already available in some places, due to cost and proprietary technologies they are often ill suited for global deployment or use in resource-limited settings. With SENSE we are trying to remove this bottleneck by designing open-source, low-cost vitals and electrochemical sensors that excel in both environmental and biological sample testing.

The Global Tricorder: Our Future

Here at the Distributed Health Labs, we truly believe that the work we are doing will help transform health and medicine around the world, and we know that we aren't the only ones who feel this way. That's why we've joined the $10 million Qualcomm Tricorder XPRIZE, a global competition, funded by the Qualcomm Foundation, to offer the first reliable and understandable diagnosis of 15 common health conditions plus real-time monitoring of five key vital signs.  By utilizing low-cost diagnostic devices in conjunction with the ubiquity of cell phones and wireless networks, we hope to create a globally connected tricorder that empowers local communities. We are proud to be a part of such a landmark competition alongside other incredible groups vying for the prize.


OASIS Mongolia: First steps in the environment

Individual sensing is only one half of OASIS. The other is sharing data to create global insights. By sharing data, we can extrapolate from hyper-local information from thousands of users to pinpoint sweeping trends across cities and countries. We'll be able to create real-time "living maps" of the issues that matter most to us.

Starting in Mongolia. While some hazards are easy to see (e.g. fire, smoke), others are not.  Heavy metals such as lead, mercury, and arsenic can enter our lives in invisible ways, through our drinking water or the soil where food is grown.  The devastation these metals cause to our personal health can be insidious, but there are things we can do about this -- provided we can see the problem.  Mongolia is home to the last horse-based nomadic culture in the world, where almost half of the population lives a traditional nomadic lifestyle. The vast stretch of prairies, pristine rivers, and lakes that are the key to nomadic existence also hold immense natural deposits of gold, copper, coal, uranium, and other industrial minerals. Thus the country has witnessed the birth of an internationally driven and highly aggressive mining sector. Much of this activity goes unregulated, and unsustainable mining practices have caused river and ground systems to be polluted with invisible but toxic heavy metals and mining waste products.

 OASIS Mongolia aims to empower nomadic communities by providing a low cost, community-based testing system for lead, mercury, cyanide, uranium and arsenic in ground drinking water. Nomads will be able to use existing cellular networks in Mongolia to send and receive results on their cell-phones along with information regarding nearby clean-water sources. Through this ecosystem we hope to crowdsource a living map of water pollution "hotspots" enabling citizen-powered environmental monitoring. OASIS-Mongolia will serve as the launchpad for a global OASIS Project built with citizen-sensors like you. 

Who We Are

Distributed Health Labs is based at UC San Diego's Qualcomm Institute.  We are a passionate, multidisciplinary team that is united in its determination to usher in a new age of technology-enabled global health. We are guided by the belief that by leveraging inexpensive sensors and digital connectivity, together we can change the global health equation – be it individual, community, or environmental health. Our mission is to create an open community of innovators and adopters to make that happen.


News Links:

Fast Company Coverage

National Geographic Newswatch Blog

story:
Short Summary

At Marilyn and Michelle, we are girlfriends who found one another through our shared journey of having double mastectomies.  Our goal is simply to help women who are recovering from breast issues related to cancer, enhancements, reductions or simply large breasted or pregnant gals who are side or stomach sleepers. After all, if you’re recovering from surgery, what you need most is a good night’s sleep. Sweet, solid, sleep.  

Sleep is such a big part of recovery and it was something we both struggled to do much of after our mastectomies. Marilyn had breast cancer and Michelle had a long family history of the disease and made a preventative choice. So we asked ourselves – how can we fix this? And with that our TaTa Topper idea was crafted with the help of our families, friends and countless others that we are thankful to now call friends.

After our surgeries we both felt as though the process of recovery should be easier for women.  Beyond dealing with the emotional and physical pain, sleep was much too difficult.  Lack of sleep created more problems for us.  Depression set in and the healing process became more difficult.  We both believe that we can help other women avoid some of the stress caused by lack of sleep.  Like so many women in our community, we just wanted to help in some way.  Creating the TaTa Topper and other comfort products is our way of paying it forward.  
With your donations, we will be able to get our business up and running.  That means we can start helping more women get more sleep and hopefully heal much faster with less discomfort.  We all know what it’s like not to sleep well.  Giving a donation is giving the gift of sleep and healing.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $20,000.00 to cover our start up expenses and initial production. 

We began working on TaTa Toppers this past spring, and so far have poured our hearts and bank accounts into funding all activities and expenses for this passion project of ours. However, we have come to realize that in order to produce an economically sensible amount of TaTaToppers that can reach at least 200 women, we need your support! 

We'd like to bring our company to the public, but we can't do it alone! Your funding will help us to make this idea become a reality.

We have been reminded by many people that in order for us to do good in this world and improve the lives of women that share our experiences, we must be a financially viable company. 

We are striving to make the TaTa Topper available to women by the start of 2015. 

As a thank you for your contributions, below is a list of what you will get in return: 

$ 25 - TaTa Topper sticker and personal note 

$ 50 - "Support the TaTa Topper so it can Support you" T-Shirt 

$100 - 10 of our favorite recipes to make for a recovering friend (Soups, Casseroles, Gift Baskets, and great food ideas for kids) 

$ 200 - Comfort pack for a friend made by Wellpack

$ 500 -TaTa Topper for you or a donation of one to VCU's Massey Cancer Center

$ 1,000 - Dinner with the founders

The Impact

This project is important to us because we have been there.  We have suffered through the long sleepless nights and if we can help women feel a tiny bit more normal during a rough time, we want to make that difference for them.  We feel that our product is simple yet effective.  It brings comfort when comfort is hard to find.  We have been lucky enough to use our product and share it with close friends who are also healing from mastectomies.  Their testimonials have been positive and they are telling their doctors how well they are sleeping thanks to the TaTaTopper.

Risks & Challenges

The risk in starting this business is if we are not able to afford our first round of production then we will lose the money that we have invested so far.  We have been able to brand our company and produce our first prototypes, however, without being able to sell them we risk losing not only that money but most importantly, the brand.  

We need to make both women and doctors aware of our product and to educate them about the benefits TaTa Toppers offer. We plan to address these challenges through our RIchmond business colleagues and network of friends, as well as publicly on our blog and website.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations are just one way we can use your support! You can also help us by spreading the word about TaTaToppers!  The more people that know about this product, the more women we will be able to reach.

And with that our TaTa Topper idea was crafted with the help of our families, friends and countless others that we are thankful to now call friends. After our surgeries we both felt as though the process of recovery should be easier for women.  Beyond dealing with the emotional and physical pain, sleep was much too difficult.  Lack of sleep created more problems for us.  Depression set in and the healing process became more difficult.  We both believe that we can help other women avoid some of the stress caused by lack of sleep.  Like so many women in our community, we just wanted to help in some way.  Creating the TaTa Topper and other comfort products is our way of paying it forward.  
With your donations, we will be able to get our business up and running.  That means we can start helping more women get more sleep and hopefully heal much faster with less discomfort.  We all know what it’s like not to sleep well.  Giving a donation is giving the gift of sleep and healing.    What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is to raise $20,000.00 to cover our start up expenses and initial production. 
We began working on TaTa Toppers this past spring, and so far have poured our hearts and bank accounts into funding all activities and expenses for this passion project of ours. However, we have come to realize that in order to produce an economically sensible amount of TaTaToppers that can reach at least 200 women, we need your support! 
We'd like to bring our company to the public, but we can't do it alone! Your funding will help us to make this idea become a reality.
We have been reminded by many people that in order for us to do good in this world and improve the lives of women that share our experiences, we must be a financially viable company. 
We are striving to make the TaTa Topper available to women by the start of 2015. 
As a thank you for your contributions, below is a list of what you will get in return: 
$ 25 - TaTa Topper sticker and personal note 
$ 50 - "Support the TaTa Topper so it can Support you" T-Shirt 
$100 - 10 of our favorite recipes to make for a recovering friend (Soups, Casseroles, Gift Baskets, and great food ideas for kids) 
$ 200 - Comfort pack for a friend made by Wellpack
$ 500 -TaTa Topper for you or a donation of one to VCU's Massey Cancer Center
$ 1,000 - Dinner with the founders
The Impact

 This project is important to us because we have been there.  We have suffered through the long sleepless nights and if we can help women feel a tiny bit more normal during a rough time, we want to make that difference for them.  We feel that our product is simple yet effective.  It brings comfort when comfort is hard to find.  We have been lucky enough to use our product and share it with close friends who are also healing from mastectomies.  Their testimonials have been positive and they are telling their doctors how well they are sleeping thanks to the TaTaTopper.
Risks & Challenges
The risk in starting this business is if we are not able to afford our first round of production then we will lose the money that we have invested so far.  We have been able to brand our company and produce our first prototypes, however, without being able to sell them we risk losing not only that money but most importantly, the brand.  
We need to make both women and doctors aware of our product and to educate them about the benefits TaTa Toppers offer. We plan to address these challenges through our RIchmond business colleagues and network of friends, as well as publicly on our blog and website.

Other Ways You Can Help 
Donations are just one way we can use your support! You can also help us by spreading the word about TaTaToppers!  The more people that know about this product, the more women we will be able to reach.

story:
Support our healthcare workers! Our first campaign raised over $16,000 

**See our updates for shipments on the way, the story of one of Liberia's finest doctors surviving ebola! 


A call to action for anyone who is, was or ever will be a patient and for emergency care workers world wide

Health care workers in emergency medicine and primary care are considered the frontlines of healthcare in the US. We're there when you need us and we're there for each other. Despite being on the “frontlines” this job that we love involves minimal risks here at home even though we occasionally fall victim to a cold or the dreaded stomach flu. Working abroad on the frontlines of healthcare our team of doctors from across the US have never felt so welcomed and embraced than in Liberia, West Africa. We have come to know and love the country, despite it being one of the smallest and poorest nations in the world.

I’m often asked “Why Liberia?” The answer – the people.

Despite their devastating civil war the people of Liberia have regained hope, optimism and the drive to put their country back together with a determination and spirit that should inspire others. The healthcare system in particular was virtually destroyed during the war and now 10 years later they have reestablished the training systems for physicians, physician assistants and nurses. These healthcare workers are on the frontlines for Liberia and its citizens combating disease in health clinics and hospitals every day.

The frontlines in Liberia look far different than here at home. The country’s 2 pediatricians are responsible for the care of 80 or more hospitalized children daily, the nurses work at a ratio of up to 1 nurse to 15 patients, the 2 physicians assistants care for 100+ outpatients daily and just 3 surgeons staff an operating room for emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year. The frontlines in Liberia were always a little more dangerous for healthcare workers as compared to the US. There are risks of contracting vaccine preventable diseases like meningitis, diphtheria, pertussis or the tropical diseases lurking around every corner. The healthcare frontlines in Liberia have never been under attack - until now. Liberia, and its neighbors Sierra Leone and Guinea, have been attacked from within by the deadly Ebola Hemorrhagic Virus.

In a world where conflict and war is raging on across so many countries, this is a war with no sides and no fault. There were no instigators, there will be no winners but the victims are many. The number of people killed by Ebola in this three-country region is more than half the total number of deaths from all prior outbreaks in Africa combined. Healthcare workers are on the frontlines where the sick flock, their safety is in jeopardy while they charge straight into danger to care for their own people.

Ebola is a highly contagious virus with no cure and no vaccine that spreads easily through contact. In the people that it affects starts out like any cold with fever and vomiting but turns into deadly internal bleeding. Ebola infection has claimed the lives of 21 brave healthcare workers and infected over 37. Only 1 in 3 infected with the virus are expected to survive this deadly disease, making the frontlines of healthcare in Liberia as deadly as armed conflict. Yet these brave individuals put their lives on the line to treat emergencies, pregnant women, children and those with chronic disease. Healthcare cannot come to a halt while Liberia waits for Ebola to go away. What would happen? We are already starting to find out.

Clinics and hospitals are being forced to close due to lack of protective equipment for their staff. When facilities are closed what happens to the child who comes there for malaria treatment or asthma? What happens to the man with the incarcerated hernia or the women in obstructed labor? If the health facilities are not open they fall victim to the Ebola virus as well – the virus that caused these facilities to be closed and the staff to be unable to care for them.


The brave healthcare workers have a fierce determination to continue to care for patients risking their own lives and feel it is their national responsibility to take care of their own people. Never more so demonstrated than by the example of Dr. Samuel Brisbane an ER physician and director of the ER of one of the country's few hospitals who died from Ebola after contracting it from a patient. In a country with precious few healthcare workers – just 254 doctors and 1,200 nurses for 4.1 million people they need to be armed for their fight.

The arms needed in Liberia are not missiles or rockets. The arms Liberia needs are simple: gloves, gowns, masks and shoe covers for general screening and the Tyvek "space suits" seen on the news and in movies. This equipment allows healthcare workers to protect themselves and save the lives of patients. In a world with so many wars help Liberia fight its peaceful war against Ebola by saving the life a healthcare worker.


Help us put what’s needed in the hands of our friends and colleagues in Liberia by funding a country-wide initiative! 

One set of protective wear costs of $2.50

One set of Ebola treatment suits costs $80

How many healthcare workers will you save? 

We are partnering with existing in-country response efforts to take a 3 prong approach: 

1. Fund additional treatment centers as the current ones are overwhelmed with patients

2. Fund protective wear and training for Liberian healthcare workers in the hospitals 

3. Fund additional contact and quarantine tracing to help control and stop the outbreak. 

This is a joint effort between: 

Physicians from Boston Children's Hospital, University of Massachusetts Medical Center, Baystate Medical Center & others in partnership with the Liberian Metro-Boston Association, The Worcester Liberian Association, Health Education and Relief Through Teaching (HEARTT). 


Why is our goal 250k? Because that is what it would take to protect healthcare workers, expand treatment facilities and contain this outbreak to end it and allow Liberia to continue to grow and develop! 

**if you were part of our first campaign that money is already in use to deliver equipment now to our friends and healthcare workers in Monrovia.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi My name is Peri Alletto, 
  • My daughter, Emily, has been diagnosed with AML Leukemia 
  • Cover medical expenses not covered by insurance company for Cancer Treatment 
  • Any money donated that is extra will be donated to Children's Hospital for Leukemia Research. 


What We Need

  • We do not know how much funding we need, for our daughter was just admitted last 11-1-2013, so we shall see when the medical claims start coming. The funding will be used to cover Emily's medical expenses as they come about. 
  • This gives you the opportunity to pay it forward to benefit others in need. 
  • If there is any extra funds left, all proceeds will be donated to Children's Hospital LA for further Cancer Research in children. 

The Impact

  • This gives you the opportunity to help a child in need. 
  • We do not have a clue what to expect, but we pray each day that our daughter will survive the next 6-8 month stay in the hospital that is expected. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

  • If you can't contribute that is alright, it would be nice that you donate blood at your local blood bank.

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Louise Mckay. I am the Grandmother to the Conjoined Twins , Tatiana and Krista Hogan. Tatiana and Krista are joined at the head. They are my joy and my ray of sunshine. Most precious girls to ever walk this earth. I am also on a pension so don't have the money or i would gladly just give the money to my daughter for their glasses

This page was made by me because my Grandaughters need special glasses to beable to see properly. Krista is legally blind in her right eye and so needs special glasses to see. Tatiana will end up the same if she doesnt get the correctional glasses that she needs to fix her left eye. 

This Campaign is important to me because my grandaughters are my world. They already have enough to deal with being conjoined and having Diebetes and Seizures. I would go to the ends of the earth to help them to get money to buy their much needed glasses. Their parents are on a fixed income and the government wont pay for the full cost. They will only pay 150 for each child, leaving $800 to be found to pay for their glasses. Please Please help my grandaughters . You kindness will allow my grandaughters to see better and to function better. 

They cant go out right now  because of the problems seeing. They trip and fall or run into stuff. It is to Dangerous for them to be outside their home. We have to drive them to school and walk them to their class where they have to stay for the day so that they wont get hurt. With the glasses they would beable to go out and play with their peers and have fun like little children should. Please we need your help. God Bless

If you can't help. Could you please get the word out to others by using the indiegogo share tools,  The sooner i meet the goal the sooner my sweet grandaughters can get their glasses and beable to see to learn and play again. thank you from the bottom of my heart,

story:
In July of 2012, I underwent a LEEP procedure to remove abnormal, pre-cervical cancer cells.  The surgery went well and the doctors were confident I'd have nothing to worry about down the line.
Flash forward to August of this year when I received abnormal results and had to undergo another biopsy of cells to determine if I would have to undergo another procedure.
Due to age, income, etc I was not able to find affordable healthcare coverage and make just enough to be ineligible for a lot of services for women in my area.
This is where I need your help.  I have already incurred $500 in doctors visits, lab fees, and surgery since August.  I have a follow up appointment in October that will cost another $250 to determine if I need the frightfully expensive surgery.  All I am asking for is enough to cover the known expenses that are earning interest on my credit card.
What do you get in return?  I am a crafter at heart and make handmade soap, lotions, nail polishes, body scrubs, et cetera all from scratch and completely vegan.  Any of these items can and will be yours for helping out.
All additional funds raised will go towards the possible surgery, making more soaps, and my classroom.
Thanks for taking the time to read my story and supporting me :)
-Ally

story:
It's time for exoskeletons for phyical rehabilitation to make their mark on the world.

456 Boler Road houses the premiere North American bionics bootcamp for people with walking disorders who are interested in regaining their gait through bionic mobility devices. Clients may live on-site, or attend as outpatients, and are aided through a vigorous personal training routine to improve their body's capacity to support the use of exoskeleton legs, like our newest device, the Ekso™. More information about our facility can be found at www.456BolerRoad.com .

Ekso™ is a bionic exoskeleton which enables people with lower limb paralysis to stand up and walk. Battery-powered motors drive the legs and replace neuromuscular function, allowing the wearer to walk over ground with an efficient, four point reciprocal gait. The current, first generation of Ekso is intended for use in the rehabilitation setting. More information about Ekso™ can be found at www.EksoBionics.com .

456 Boler Road is seeking your contributions towards the purchase of this extremely modern device and a three year maintenance program, so we can literally get people with spinal cord injuries, multiple sclerosis and stroke victims walking again, immediately.

Thank you to all of our past, present and future contributors. Can't contribute? No worries! If you respect the campaign, share it with those you feel might be interested in helping as well. If we all share the word, our goals would almost certainly be met.

story:
Please click the UPDATES tab above for the latest on Kurt's condition.

**********************************************************************

Our friend Kurt Becker took a big fall from a ladder and is now in the ICU at Blake Medical Center in Bradenton, FL. He broke 2 vertebrae and had to have an emergency surgery to install titanium plates to secure them. He currently is paralyzed from the waist down and is going to have a LONG road to recovery. Please donate anything you can to help Kurt through this tough time and help him with his medical bills.

We will post updates on his condition as they become available.

Currently, there are also plans being put together for some fundraising events. Please check back, as we will post info on them here as well.

Let's show Kurt how much he is loved and please keep him in you thoughts and prayers. Thank you!

 

**********************************************************************

Please click the UPDATES tab above for the latest on Kurt's condition.

story:
SHRED INDOOR SKATE PARK 

My names Darcy, I have been a skateboarder since I was 13, I am now 25, it has made my life the way it is today and now I want to make it my job as well.

I want to open the first indoor skate park in Western Australia since 2003.
In my years of skateboarding everyone I have ever met has spoken about an indoor skate park and how amazing it would be to have one in WA. This is my way of giving back to the skateboarding community of WA and to skateboarding in general.

By investing in this project you will help me open a facility that has an indoor skate park (which will have separate session times for different equipment eg. skateboards, BMX) and sound proof jam rooms.
I will use this skate park to hold skate/ride competitions, live music gigs and a great place to hang out.

  

What I Need & What You Get

I need about $100,000 to open this skate park (I am funding most of this with loans and out of my own pocket) this will pay for full construction of the skate park which consists of a circle 6ft bowl with rollover, bank to wallride with a flat ledge, vert wall, long 5ft quarter with pocket and hip, and a downward street section with interchangeable obstacles including 5 stair, euro gap, banks, changeable rail and ledges either side one curved and the other basic.
This will also pay for construction of a mezzanine balcony section for people to look out over the skate park or to rest and watch.
I will also be building 1 sound proof jam room for bands to practice in and a sound proof theatre room(which could also be used as a jam room) which will have the latest and retro consoles and a huge range of games and movies to play and watch.

The perks you will get if you donate are, entry to the skate park, memberships(which offer free entry during all open hours excluding events), tickets to opening day and after party, private hours in the jam/theatre rooms and close out days( all access for you and your friends only).

If I don't reach my entire goal I will still open the skate park eventually, so if you donate you will get your perks when its open.

Why Should You Contribute

If you have ever been on a skateboard, bike, rollerblades, or scooter you will understand how awesome it would be able to go on an indoor skate park in your own state.
There is many things that prevent us from doing what we want including rain, ridiculous heat and the dark. This skate park is going to be open til 10'oclock at night(sometimes even later) so rainy night sessions will be easy.

Wooden ramps are something different, if you've never been on them they are a lot more forgiving than concrete parks, when you fall its half the pain of a slam on concrete.

There will be separate session for younger children and the more experienced, this will prevent the worry of seeing a kid appear at the bottom of a quarter when you just launched a large gap.

Separate sessions for Skaters, riders and others, everyone rolls a different way and getting snaked ruins every ones day.

Every dollar counts, every share counts, every single person you tell about this matters.

Any extra money I get over what I have asked for will go towards paying the bills and rent in advance to secure the indoor skate park stays open. 

 

DONT FORGET TO USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS
story_txt: SHRED INDOOR SKATE PARK My names Darcy, I have been a skateboarder since I was 13, I am now 25, it has made my life the way it is today and now I want to make it my job as well.I want to open the first indoor skate park in Western Australia since 2003.In my years of skateboarding everyone I have ever met has spoken about an indoor skate park and how amazing it would be to have one in WA. This is my way of giving back to the skateboarding community of WA and to skateboarding in general.By investing in this project you will help me open a facility that has an indoor skate park (which will have separate session times for different equipment eg. skateboards, BMX) and sound proof jam rooms.I will use this skate park to hold skate/ride competitions, live music gigs and a great place to hang out.  What I Need & What You GetI need about $100,000 to open this skate park (I am funding most of this with loans and out of my own pocket) this will pay for full construction of the skate park which consists of a circle 6ft bowl with rollover, bank to wallride with a flat ledge, vert wall, long 5ft quarter with pocket and hip, and a downward street section with interchangeable obstacles including 5 stair, euro gap, banks, changeable rail and ledges either side one curved and the other basic.This will also pay for construction of a mezzanine balcony section for people to look out over the skate park or to rest and watch.I will also be building 1 sound proof jam room for bands to practice in and a sound proof theatre room(which could also be used as a jam room) which will have the latest and retro consoles and a huge range of games and movies to play and watch.The perks you will get if you donate are, entry to the skate park, memberships(which offer free entry during all open hours excluding events), tickets to opening day and after party, private hours in the jam/theatre rooms and close out days( all access for you and your friends only).If I don't reach my entire goal I will still open the skate park eventually, so if you donate you will get your perks when its open.Why Should You ContributeIf you have ever been on a skateboard, bike, rollerblades, or scooter you will understand how awesome it would be able to go on an indoor skate park in your own state.There is many things that prevent us from doing what we want including rain, ridiculous heat and the dark. This skate park is going to be open til 10'oclock at night(sometimes even later) so rainy night sessions will be easy.Wooden ramps are something different, if you've never been on them they are a lot more forgiving than concrete parks, when you fall its half the pain of a slam on concrete.There will be separate session for younger children and the more experienced, this will prevent the worry of seeing a kid appear at the bottom of a quarter when you just launched a large gap.Separate sessions for Skaters, riders and others, everyone rolls a different way and getting snaked ruins every ones day.Every dollar counts, every share counts, every single person you tell about this matters.Any extra money I get over what I have asked for will go towards paying the bills and rent in advance to secure the indoor skate park stays open.  DONT FORGET TO USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS

story:
"Help us help her so she can start helping others"

This is a new campaign as Rise is now ready for stage 2 in her treatment - and in her life as she is ready to help others;


- Brand new unique pain and stresss handling techniques - highly evaluated by specialists.open workshop.

- Production of new, much more comfortable  oxygen eqipment ! 

We think it is pretty cool; 
  Figthing for her life, raising herself -  right away starts planning how to help others - planning entrepreneurship capital investors valued highly
           - AT THE AGE OF 50!

Since this is a situation with a of lot background knowledge  in many areas,  it is impossible to gather all this in a clear way,  therefore you have the opportunity to read more by clicking on the links (you will also find it in danish on those websites) and if you have questions or comments please feel free to write and you will hear from us very quickly - thanks for understanding!

Our first campaign;

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/chamber-for-rise/x/579039

Rises situation  - HBO home treatment, documentation etc,     www.artderise.com both in danish and english.(Treatment in progress)

The last two years - the background for  this campaign;

http://www.artderise-uniq.com/prework-for-the-center


WHY ARE WE BACK WITH A NEW CAMPAIGN ?

After using the decompresing chamber for 2 years,Rise`s health has improved to the almost unrecgnizable  and is ready to be able to live a much more normal life...

 She  still experinces few symptoms in certain activities, social  and work related  situations - if ignored they get very serious.  To find a balance where all symptoms are covered anyone agree; a stronger chamber that can provide a higher pressure so she can adjust after need  will solve the last  problems.

The reasons we unconditionally provide full support for a new fundraising campaign is that Rise has done a tremendous effort to try to help others the last two years.
She has not spared herself but has done an extreme effort.

She realized she COULD  help  and started to see how to organize it. It ended up in plans for a center !! 

We want to help her -also cause noone ever expected her to survice -  and be able to do anything like this !!

BUT - to be able to go awy where from here,  she needs a chamber that can provide a stroger pressure ! 

  

MORE ABOUT THE CENTER;

Rise suffers from a very rare kind of spinal damage causing  extreme symptoms. And at least 12  other disorders - one is a rare genetic, multisystemic connective tissue disease (Ehlers Danloss Syndrome) 
To survive and retain as much "quality of life "as possible, she developed various unique pain handling techniques.
You can see more abut what kind of pain she had to deal with here;http://www.artderise.com/blog/2012/07/11/Pain-scale.aspx
Her pain and stress management medical specialists  have encouraged her to  publish   ! 

She will be working wih doctors and physiotherapists at the center !

THE PROGRAM..

  Different from, for example, traditional N.L.P. - this is an authentic, complex program, developed under long-term, extreme pressure both physically and mentally. As a way of survival.


Program consists of;

- The "talking with yourself"  (N.L.P.)technique is introduced to you with instructions for individual use as long as you need.

Combind with;

-  Special kind of relaxation,

 - Breathing techniques,

 - Posture control and

 - Attitude training and

 - Massage

 - All as a complext program.

In addition  combined with creativity;

- Intuitive paint enhances your inner dialogues - colors, shapes, words, symbols.

When, for example, translate words into forms of movement it will activate more brain centers and to enhance understanding and effectiveness !

- Of course you can not change the reality and the things that have happened,  but you can help yourself by changing your experience and easen the symptoms  by "talking to yourself" in a new way about the incident,combind it with the special relaxsation  in this program,  and using intuitive painting, change attitude and future behavior.- By using all parts of the program you will  not only change the way you think but also the way you feel. 

You can read more here;

http://www.artderise-uniq.com/stress-pain-handling-program-2

and about the different parts of the program here;

http://www.artderise-uniq.com/the-different-parts

And in danish; 

http://www.artderise-uniq.com/stress-og-smerteh-ndtering-2

http://www.artderise-uniq.com/hovedpunkter


WHO CAN USE IT ?

We humans are incredibly diverse.

For some it will be too strange !!

For others something they can learn after a little while, for others pure fun from day one!

You will need to be able to use your imagination, your fantasy.

This is a  concept of great social and human value. With very few simple measures it can reach many people and become a center with activities to improve quality of life. 





There are more plans for other activities and services - again very uniqu services ! There is still too much needed prework to start talking about these now, but  other exciting things wil come ! 

WEBSHOP

There will also be a webshop with written, easy to follow e-learning magazines to buy and download. 

http://www.artderise-uniq.com/members-area


 WHEN?

It all depends on this highly needed  chamber  – since this is a situation that depends on Rises situation –  she needs  help, this campaign is listed under health and not entrepreneurship. 

If she can have a stronger chamber soon a realistic plan for starting the center and the first activities in this year - 2014! There are of course still many details but starting several of the planned activities can easily be in this year!


WHAT DO YOU GET IF YOU ARE NOT CLOSE TO THE CENTER ? 

This is a program you can  have acess to if you have an online connection ! (offcourse not the massage etc but most other parts will be available)

 - You can have the full written program.  (Files, videos etc)

- Online, confidente  sessions with Rise. 


 So please JOIN US so we can make something spectacular !!


WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DONT REACH THE GOAL ? 

We will again be extremely gratefull for ALL help ! 


- WHAT HAPPENS IF WE GO OVER THE GOAL ?
 Then there will be money for accessories for the chamber.
 All what is used inside must be 100 percent cotton; pillows, blankets, clothes.  LEDlamps would be great ! Or a cooler - it can be very hot inside a chamber !
 Always needed are also special disinfetions and cleaner for this kind of eqipment.
 A rail would also be good as it will make it easier for Rise to get in and out of the chamber as disabled. Like all special eipment it is very expensive.


Rise in the needed chamber - when she inspected it


WHAT DO WE NEED?


 1 flexilite chamber;      13000 usd
 Service in New York;      1720 usd
 Shipping;                              2500 usd
 VAT  for filters etc,send from New York to be installed in Denmark 
 411 usd VAT;                           101 usd
 Acount; (same as last)      920 usd
 Fee - estimated                      1325 usd  
 -  unexpected  etc  - rounded up to the 
  Total of;                                             20000 usd



 Perks;

 Are all from Rise, expences to produce them will NOT be taken from the incoming funds! Just please add to shipping where this is mentioned. All contributors will be on a list and you will all be kept updated during the process from now on NOMATTER the amount donated.

    

IMPORTANT THOUGHTS ABOUT PERKS BASIC AND CONTRIBUTING GENERALLY !     

During the last campaign some people wrote and excused they were not able to help with more than one dollar and they felt bad as they felt that would be way to little but they wanted to send their best wishes ! We were deeply moved over this and of course answered right back than NO donation is too small to count! After the fundraising we could see actually a huge amount was these one dollar-donations! This only proves that if we are many that help we can do a lot!!

And please be assured that any one want to help is very, very appreciated by all of us here! Being in a difficult situation and experiencing financial problems on top makes it hard to feel you can make a difference. Well you most certainly can.

- A thank you email written by Rise personal.
 - You will be part of a common email list from this campaign  with detailed   updates.
 - 10 percent of all you buy from www.artderise-uniq.com
 - 10 percent of all services offered through the center in the future! 


Perks 1 and 5 usd; wallpaperr for cellphone or tablet.

Please remember to mention the number you want!

se many more here; 

http://www.artderise-uniq.com/1-usd-donation-perks


Perks 20  USD
 - As 1 and 5 usd
- Calender  below; front and back


Perks 30  USD
 - As 1 and 5  usd 
FEATURED ! Swan card and ad 5 usd for shipping - specify for number from left to right, 1 to 5

  (10,5 x 14 cm)  


Perks 50  USD
 - As 1  and 5 usd 
 - Zebra wrap  E.D.S. SPECIAL !!! 
Exclusice !! Many Ehlers- Danlos patients asocierer themselves with zebras there fore I made these wraps especially for us ! 
The wrap is made from  delicious felt with zebra embroidery - specify for colour choise in embroidery. you can have almost any colour you want  !
The wrap is re usable, you can fill a new notebook. 10x 15 cm  It comes without notebook. 
Ad 5 usd for shipping.



Perks 300  USD
 - as 1 and  5  usd 
 - Bag from art derise uniq
   Add 15 usd for shipping see more here; http://www.artderise-uniq.com/bags




Perks 600  USD

-As 1 and 5 usd 

- Swan painting Please write and agree on details and shipping nr 5 se more here;http://www.artderise-uniq.com/ugly-ducklings-blue-swans

belowe; nr 7 is no longer available ! 

 

Perks 1000 USD- 

As 1 and 5  usd

Painting from the line Golden Blue Hour - Horizonal Refelctions please write and agree on details and add for shipping

 


Perks 2000  USD

- As 1 and 5 usd

- Weekend at the hotel near the center, a full package service and sightseeing ! 


Perks  artderise-uniq.com


This fundraising is notified to the Danish authorities after special laws regarding public fundraisings.  All funds will have to go to this one bank account, especially set up for this purpose.  An accountant must approve the accounts of fundraising. This is standard procedure in Denmark when fundraising is used. Our account from the first fundraising was approved.
Thank you
Anette, Sara,Rise and Yvonne.

story:
As many of you know, Paxton has been a sickly child for quite awhile. Sarah was able to take him to a naturopath last week, and after a long, but much needed discussion, it was suggested that Paxton may have a food sensitivity. As such, Sarah is now navigating the dairy-free world, and will likely be removing other items from Pax's diet, such as gluten.

A change like this can be quite overwhelming as there are so many alternative food choices these days. However, from Sarah's post last week, it became quite obvious that she and Rob have a lot of support from friends and family. I'm wondering if you would consider extending your support in the form of a Vitamix for Sarah's birthday next month. A Vitamix will do wonders for her ability to make rice/nut flours, fruit/veggie smoothies, and many other healthy foods for Pax, but unfortunately, they don't come cheap.

20+ people commented on and "Liked" Sarah's post. If everyone contributed $20, we could get her a Vitamix on sale through the US Costco. As I don't have access to all of Sarah and Rob's friends and family, please feel free to add guests as you see fit. The more people we can get contributing, the better.

Sarah and Rob have been an incredible source of support for me and my family through my husband's deployment and my health issues more recently. All the while, they've had their fair share of trials and tribulations. I'd really like to do something to brighten their days and I hope you will help me make this idea a reality.

Thank you and please DO NOT share this with Rob and Sarah.

story:
The Problem

Partisan politics and the rising cost of healthcare are destroying the ability for this generation to have immediate access to quality healthcare. It's time to break the healthcare paradigm. With the changes that are upon us, access to healthcare is at its most critical moment in history.

Our concept is to bring immediate and affordable healthcare to everyone. With your contribution, you will enable us to meet with the top telemedicine minds in North America at the American Telemedicine Association Conference. You will help us get one step closer to bringing you access to board certified doctors via telephone, secure email or videoconferencing from your home, school, vacation or anywhere.

With this campaign, not only will you help increase access to healthcare, you can score some great perks, including the opportunity to help us name our service! See the side bar for details.

We are Jim Devitt and Todd Martin. We have worked in healthcare for the past 20 years and quite frankly, we're sick of what we've seen. The system is broken. Costs are rising and care is getting harder to find.

Here's what the American Medical Association and the media are saying about it:

The shortage of primary care physicians will make it more difficult to see the doctor, wait times will increase beyond comprehension: http://www.amednews.com/article/20130701/business/130709995/9/.

High Deductible Insurance Plans will increase the burden on the middle class, taking more dollars out of your pockets before your plan pays a dime: http://articles.latimes.com/2013/may/05/business/la-fi-healthcare-watch-20130505.


Enough—individuals deserve better. Patients shouldn't have to sit in waiting rooms in the ER or doctor's office for hours to seek treatment for simple issues. This generation knows the value of time and trusts mobile technology. It's time to change the broken healthcare system and start treating patients in the privacy and comfort of their home.


It's time for real change.

Our project will bring telemedicine into the homes of anyone, regardless of insurance status. Patients shouldn't have to sit in waiting rooms in the ER or doctor's office for hours to seek treatment for simple issues.This generation knows the value of time and trusts mobile technology.

            "Telemedicine is an ideal consultative tool ..." the Mayo Clinic,          http://www.mayo.edu/research/discoverys-edge/helping-fix-broken-health-care-system.

Most everyone agrees that telemedicine has a place in healthcare today, however, why is not more prevalent?

It's time to change the broken healthcare system and start treating patients in the privacy and comfort of their home. But we need your help. Your contribution will help us provide quality and immediate healthcare to you and others like you.

  • Phase I is to cover the costs of the American Telemedicine Associations Fall Forum, where we'll be meeting with others in the industry to design and build a telemedicine program for the masses. The contributions will also be used to develop the infrastructure of the organization and ready it for operational build-out.
  • Phase II will involve securing the operational structure and building the infrastructure.
  • Phase III is the most exciting phase- launch of Affordable and Immediate Healthcare to all people.

So, we're turning to those who will benefit the most. You. In exchange for your support, we're offering a variety of perks, including free access to telemedicine services.  Thank You!

When we hit our Phase I goal, we'll be adding new and awesome Perks!


The Impact

We don't have to wait for the government to decide what's best for us. Affordable access to healthcare could be as close as your living room.

Telemedicine has been around for nearly 50 years, yet most of us have never encountered remote delivery of healthcare. With the introductions of new technologies and the prevalence of smart phones, tablets, remote monitoring and diagnostics tools, mobile healthcare should be no different than delivery of stock information or flight schedules.

Currently, less than 1% of Americans have access to telemedicine.

The Affordable Care Act might be on the horizon, with nearly 30 million more insured individuals in the U.S., however, that doesn't solve the problem.

  • Are you tired of being treated like cattle, wasting hours in your doctor's waiting room?
  • Do you avoid the doctor because you don't have the time or money to go?
  • Are you fed up with insurance companies making huge profits while covering less?
  • Should you have to spend hundreds of dollars for a simple emergency room visit?
  • Have you ever awakened in the middle of the night with you or your children experiencing symptoms where a simple telemedicine phone call could give you piece of mind?
  • Do online symptom checkers make you feel like every ailment is the worst case scenario?
For the first time in history, all people can have access to affordable and immediate healthcare. A healthier population is stable and enjoys a better quality of life. It's time to  break the paradigm and have quality healthcare available ANYWHERE at costs less than a few latte's per month.

We are confident that with your help, we can make this dream a reality. Our team has a solid background in management, sales, IT and operations of healthcare facilities. It's time to do what no insurance company wants us to do, provide affordable and immediate healthcare on your terms.

We added some great new perks!

Here's you chance to grab some baseball history. One of a kind perks with some telemedicine sprinkled in:

Mr. October signed baseball

For a contribution of $200 we'll send you this Reggie Jackson autographed baseball. Own a piece of history from the legendary New York Yankee slugger.

Ken Griffey Jr. signed baseball

For a contribution of $250 we'll send you an official American League baseball signed by the future Hall-of-Famer, Ken Griffey Jr. Included in this perk are two months of telemedicine service before its available to the general public.


Yastrzemski signed baseball

For a contribution of $250 we'll send you this Carl Yastrezemski autographed baseball. This signed ball by the Boson Red Sox legend would look great on your mantle! You'll stay healthy with this perk, because you'll receive two months of telemedicine service before its available to the general public.



McGwire autographed baseball

For a contribution of $250 we'll send you this Mark McGwire autographed baseball and you'll receive two months of telemedicine service before its available to the general public.


Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that not everyone can contribute and I thank you for reading this far. If you feel that affordable and immediate healthcare is important, please share this campaign with others.
story_txt:
The Problem
Partisan politics and the rising cost of healthcare are destroying the ability for this generation to have immediate access to quality healthcare. It's time to break the healthcare paradigm. With the changes that are upon us, access to healthcare is at its most critical moment in history.
Our concept is to bring immediate and affordable healthcare to everyone. With your contribution, you will enable us to meet with the top telemedicine minds in North America at the American Telemedicine Association Conference. You will help us get one step closer to bringing you access to board certified doctors via telephone, secure email or videoconferencing from your home, school, vacation or anywhere.
With this campaign, not only will you help increase access to healthcare, you can score some great perks, including the opportunity to help us name our service! See the side bar for details.
We are Jim Devitt and Todd Martin. We have worked in healthcare for the past 20 years and quite frankly, we're sick of what we've seen. The system is broken. Costs are rising and care is getting harder to find. Here's what the American Medical Association and the media are saying about it:


The shortage of primary care physicians will make it more difficult to see the doctor, wait times will increase beyond comprehension: http://www.amednews.com/article/20130701/business/130709995/9/.
High Deductible Insurance Plans will increase the burden on the middle class, taking more dollars out of your pockets before your plan pays a dime: http://articles.latimes.com/2013/may/05/business/la-fi-healthcare-watch-20130505.



Enough—individuals deserve better. Patients shouldn't have to sit in waiting rooms in the ER or doctor's office for hours to seek treatment for simple issues. This generation knows the value of time and trusts mobile technology. It's time to change the broken healthcare system and start treating patients in the privacy and comfort of their home.

It's time for real change.

Our project will bring telemedicine into the homes of anyone, regardless of insurance status. Patients shouldn't have to sit in waiting rooms in the ER or doctor's office for hours to seek treatment for simple issues.This generation knows the value of time and trusts mobile technology.

story:
Short Summary

Hello my name is Susan I am thirty nine years old with severe degenerative disc disease from a spinal injury.  I am a wife and mother, daughter and have a huge love for my fur babies.  I love life as l am a survivor of major depression and anxiety.  I enjoy being active hiking with my dogs, going to the beach and hanging out with my family.  My relationship with my daughter is the most important to me and presently l let her down all the time.  I can't do anything physical with her it breaks my heart to not be a good mom.  Last year I took on a huge challenge of going back to school for Social Services, because l wanted to make a difference in someone else’s life.  In the future I want to assist people going through mental illness as l have personal personal experience in this area.   My back was so bad l could no longer do my job in retail as it was torture standing on the concrete floors. Life is to be lived on the soccer fields not sitting in the bleachers watching life go by as life is short.

Seven years ago l fell bad on ice at my apartment l was renting at the time.  I was very sore but at the time had depression and was nervous to go to the hospital from past stima's over my depression issues.  My doctor would never tell me for sure what l did to my back only saying you have degenerative disc diease starting.  Then three years ago a psyio therepasit said to me do you know that did huge spinal damage in you L5 disc and that you have a really bad back.  These past seven years my back has really caused me to miss out on lots of quality living having to live life on the bleachers.  Daily l live with huge amounts of pain taking pain medication to combat this as my lower back pain and pain down my  right leg goes to my foot.  There is countless nights l lay awake as the pain for my back is so bad like a knife stabbing and this horrible pain goes down my legs.  I have cried countless times over my back pain when the pills don't take this pain away and it hurts so bad just to breathe.  Each day more and more the pain seems to be getting worse and you really wonder what the sense of living as some times depression wants to set in again. In the morning the pain is really bad and medication has to be taken two hours in advance so l can wake up at a normal time and be able to function with some pain control over the pain.  More and more l am getting more physically disabled and if l do activities I pay the price later for doing the activity with lots of pain in return.  Lots of times the only way l can try to handle the pain is to move around all time standing siting or laying in my bed staring at four walls. I have tried so many things physio, message, pain clinic, laser, and also other things everything just seems to be a band-aide to this horrible life sentence of pain.  As my pills presently aren't working that well and seems l have to take more and more to get pain relief.  Feels like l am young person and young at heart living in a ninety years olds body.  This pain l am contending with takes so much energy and more and more l am sleeping much more this also triggers my depression at moments.  My pain causes a lot of relationship issues between my daughter and l and my husband.  My mom and dad just want me to get better.  Our family prays soon l can just get better so l can once again have a active life style.   Seems lately more and more l am becoming more shut in feeling like l am on the outside of the world looking in. The medical system in Canada will not help me the only thing they do is give me strong medicine to hide the problem causing me more health issues.  As l fight to see surgeons they say wait until you are bed ridden until we see you which depresses men even more.  My doctor told me that last time l saw her you will always have pain you have to deal with it.  There is hope in my situation as was discovered.  

How you can help

I have been given the gift of information that in Germany they do the Artifical Disc Replacement surgery this is the surgery that would fix my L5S1 disc.   Based on my research this surgery is very successful and l have spoken to several people that have had this surgery with amazing results.  My life style is very modest but l know l need to get this surgery for my life to have quality once again.  I am asking please help me to be able for my to have a quality life once again.  I want to give back to the community all the support l have been given in my life that is why l went back to school for social services.

Budget Plan for surgery

35 000 for surgery and hospital stay

2500 for rehabiltation physio and other therapies

2500 transportation for two people me and guest (friend)

How would this surgery help me....

This surgery would give me my quality of life back.  I would be able to spend time with my daughter and make fun memories with her once again.  This brings tears to my eyes to think l could be human again to be able to do everything that l can`t do now.  It would also help many close relationships in my life with friends and family.  When a person is in pain the pain takes so much energy and life from them.  

Such things people for granted as:

Being able to clean and do house work again and simply go and buy our household needs without being in pain

Hiking with my dogs 

Camping with my family

Gardening...

Thanks for reading and the interest. The surgery has to be paid in US funds so that is why l am collecting in US currency.

story: My brother has been suffering from intense migraines for over 2 years now.  He regularly misses 2 to 3 days of work each week as a result of these migraines.  His doctor has been unable to find a cause and therefore, no relief from the migraines. The snowball effect of this is loss of income, missed house and other bill payments, and difficulty even maintaining his home. Without help with this, he will likely loose his home soon and still face significant debt.  In addition to the possibility of loosing his home, his car is not in good repair and frequently breaks down.  In the sub zero temperatures in Wisconsin in January of this year, he was forced to drive to work with no heat.  I want to rescue him from financial disaster and homelessness.  Will you help?

story:
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

NUEVO PERK A LA CAMPAÑA DE CAMILA:

El artista plástico ecuatoriano Miguel Betancourt generosamente ha donado uno de sus pinturas a la campaña, para la primera persona que contribuya con USD 300.  Si presionan en GALLERY, podrán apreciar una fotografía y más información sobre este óleo sobre lienzo.  

NOTA: Incluye gastos de envío dentro de Ecuador y Estados Unidos.  

Más información sobre la obra de Miguel en:

www.miguelbetancourt.com

NEW PERK IN CAMILA´S CAMPAIGN:

The renowned Ecuadorian artist Miguel Betancourt has generously donated one of his paintings to the campaign.  The first person to contribute with $300 will take this beautiful oil canvas home!  If you click on GALLERY, you will be able to see a picture of the painting.

NOTA: Shipping costs included for Ecuador and the US.  

More info on the artist:

www.miguelbetancourt.com

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////


ACERCA DE MI:

Nací el 21 de octubre de 2002

Estudio en tercer año de educación básica.  Soy muy buena alumna.

Vivo con mi mamá Cristina, mi papá Francisco y mis hermanos Pedro y Juan.

Me encanta leer.  Me gustaría mucho ser parte del equipo de fútbol de mi escuela y pertenecer al grupo de Cheerleader.

 

ABOUT ME:

I was born on October 21st in 2002.  

I am in third grade.  I'm a very good student.

I live with my mom Cristina, my dad Francisco and my brothers Pedro and Juan.

I love reading.  I would love to be part of my school's soccer team and belong to the cheerleader team.


CAMPAÑA:

La historia:

Nuestra familia vive en Quito capital del Ecuador en Sudamérica.

Hace algo más de dos años notamos que Camila tenía dificultades para mantener el equilibrio,  además de problemas para caminar.  Luego de un tiempo fue diagnosticada con lipomeningocele, que es una malformación del tubo neural.  Además se complica porque su médula espinal está anclada a nivel de las últimas vértebras lumbares.

Su problema presenta una acumulación de tejido graso que sujeta la médula espinal y por lo tanto en su proceso normal de crecimiento, se comprimen nervios que han ocasionado que sus pies a la altura de los tobillos se deformen.   Este problema degenerativo a descalcificado sus talones; finalmente sus pies se han flexionado hacia el interior lo que hace que cuando camina se tropiece.   En los últimos meses el dolor es muy fuerte,  ella luego de regresar de la escuela debe permanecer acostada porque está completamente cansada y adolorida.

Camila es una niña muy vital, siempre le gustaron mucho las actividades lúdicas y deportivas.  A pesar de su dificultad trata de cumplir con todas las actividades de una niña de su edad.  Siempre se esfuerza y nunca se da por vencida.

La solución para este problema es una operación que corregirá la malformación del tubo neural con prótesis y  se desanclará la médula espinal.  Posteriormente deberá recibir tratamiento especializado de fisioterapia que incluirá una segunda intervención quirúrgica para corregir sus pies.

Luego de una larga espera no encontramos la manera de operarla en el Hospital Baca Ortiz, centro de asistencia pública de nuestro país (www.hospitalbacaortiz.gov.ec).  Entonces decidimos ir a un Hospital privado (www.hospitalmetropolitano.org).  En este lugar gracias a la Fundación Metrofraternidad (www.metrofraternidad.org)  por fin encontramos la manera de financiar de manera inmediata la cirugía de Camila.    Nuestro seguro privado nos contestó que apenas cubriría US$ 500 dólares de total del costo de la cirugía.   Fue por la intervención de Metrofraternidad que logramos una mayor cobertura, sin embargo aún debemos sumar una cantidad que para nuestra condición económica es elevada.  El total de la cirugía está fijado en US$ 11800,00 dólares, de los cuales la mayor parte asume Metrofraternidad.  Con nuestros ahorros aún no falta completar algo más de US$ 3000 dólares.

Por eso hemos decidido confiar en la generosidad de amigos y personas que se interesen en ayudar en esta Campaña, para recolectar el dinero faltante.


CAMPAIGN

The Story:

Our family lives in Quito, the capital of Ecuador in South America.

Over two years ago, we noticed that Camila had difficulties keeping her balance, and in addition she had problems walking.  After a while, she was diagnosed with lypomeningocele, a neural tube defect.  Her condition is further complicated by the fact that her spine is anchored at her lumbar vertebrae's level.

Her condition entails an accumulation of the fatty tissue that supports the spine.  During the normal growth process, her nerves get compressed, causing her feet to deform from her ankles downwards.  This degenerative condition has decalcified her heels bending her feet inwards, causing her to trip when she walks.  In the past few months, the pain has been particularly strong.  After school, Camila needs to stay in bed because she is completely exhausted and in pain.

Camila is a very vital girl, she always liked to participated in play and sports.  In spite of her difficulties, she tries to keep up with the activities of other kids her age.  She always makes her best effort and never gives up.

The solution to this problem is a surgery that will correct the neural tube defect with a prothesis and the spine chord will be detached.  Afterwards, she should receive specialized physiotherapy that will include a second surgery to correct her feet.  

After a long wait, we were not able to find a way to do the surgery at Hospital Baca Ortiz, the children's public hospital in Ecuador (www.hospitalbacaortiz.gov.ec).  Therefore, we decided to go to a private hospital 

(www.hospitalmetropolitano.org).  At this hospital, thanks to Foundation Metrofraternidad  (www.metrofraternidad.org), we were finally able to find an immediate way to finance Camila's surgery.  Our private insurance company only accepted to cover 500 US Dollars of the total cost of the surgery.   Metrofraternidad intervened to cover the major part of the surgery, but the remaining costs are still beyond reach for someone in our economic situation. The surgery costs in total US$ 11800,00, the majority covered by aid from Metrofraternidad. After having used all our savings to cover our share, we still need to add around US$ 3000 more to make the surgery a reality.
It is for this reason that we have decided to rely on the generosity of our friends and strangers to help our daughter and collect the funds needed to cover the remaining costs.

EL IMPACTO

La contribución que logremos con esta Campaña tendrá un significativo impacto en mejorar la calidad de vida de Camila.  Aún luego de la operación debemos continuar con su rehabilitación hasta lograr que en el transcurso del tiempo pueda volver a jugar, correr y ser una niña con actividades normales.


THE IMPACT

Your contribution will have a direct impact on improving Camila's quality of life.  After the surgery, we must continue with her rehabilitation so, with time, she is able to play, run and participate in the normal activities for a kid of her age.


LO QUE CAMILA NECESITA

Lo que logremos recaudar en esta Campaña se destinará íntegramente a completar la diferencia que debemos pagar por la cirugía de Camila.  En el caso de que se recaude un valor superior, lo destinaremos para cubrir con el tratamiento de fisioterapia y si es necesario una nueva cirugía reconstructiva de los pies de Camila.

Todas las personas que de una u otra forma apoyen la Campaña, recibirán información permanente de la recuperación de Camila.


WHAT CAMILA NEEDS

All the money obtained in this campaign will be will be used in full to pay for balance for the total cost of the surgery.  In the event that we raise more than $3,000, any exceeding amount will be used to finance the  physiotherapy treatment and, if needed, the second surgery to reconstruct Camila's feet.

Everyone who contributes will get permanent updates on Camila's recovery.


OTRAS FORMAS DE APOYAR LA CAMPAÑA

Además de la generosa contribución  en dinero, las personas que deseen pueden difundir la Campaña a través de redes sociales como Facebook, Twitter o MySpace.   También pueden compartir el enlace vía correo electrónico a sus amigos y personas dispuestas a ayudar.

www.indiegogo.com/camila


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

You can help us not only by generously donating money, but by spreading the word.  Please share our cause on Facebook, Twitter, MySpace, or any other social media.  You can also email this link to your friends or relatives.

www.indiegogo.com/camila

 

GRACIAS POR PERMITIR QUE CAMILA ¡CORRA DE NUEVO!

THANKS FOR HELPING CAMILA RUN AGAIN!
