I was born on October 21st in 2002.  
I am in third grade.  I'm a very good student.
I live with my mom Cristina, my dad Francisco and my brothers Pedro and Juan.
I love reading.  I would love to be part of my school's soccer team and belong to the cheerleader team.
CAMPAÑA:
La historia:
Nuestra familia vive en Quito capital del Ecuador
en Sudamérica.
Hace algo más de dos años notamos que Camila tenía
dificultades para mantener el equilibrio, 
además de problemas para caminar. 
Luego de un tiempo fue diagnosticada con lipomeningocele, que es una
malformación del tubo neural. 
Además se complica porque su médula espinal está anclada a nivel de las
últimas vértebras lumbares.
Su problema presenta una acumulación de tejido
graso que sujeta la médula espinal y por lo tanto en su proceso normal de
crecimiento, se comprimen nervios que han ocasionado que sus pies a la altura
de los tobillos se deformen.  
Este problema degenerativo a descalcificado sus talones; finalmente sus
pies se han flexionado hacia el interior lo que hace que cuando camina se
tropiece.   En los últimos
meses el dolor es muy fuerte,  ella
luego de regresar de la escuela debe permanecer acostada porque está
completamente cansada y adolorida.
Camila es una niña muy vital, siempre le gustaron
mucho las actividades lúdicas y deportivas.  A pesar de su dificultad trata de cumplir con todas las
actividades de una niña de su edad. 
Siempre se esfuerza y nunca se da por vencida.
La solución para este problema es una operación que
corregirá la malformación del tubo neural con prótesis y  se desanclará la médula espinal.  Posteriormente deberá recibir
tratamiento especializado de fisioterapia que incluirá una segunda intervención
quirúrgica para corregir sus pies.
Luego de una larga espera no encontramos la manera
de operarla en el Hospital Baca Ortiz, centro de asistencia pública de nuestro
país (www.hospitalbacaortiz.gov.ec).  Entonces decidimos ir a un Hospital
privado (www.hospitalmetropolitano.org).  En este lugar gracias a la Fundación
Metrofraternidad (www.metrofraternidad.org)  por fin encontramos la manera de
financiar de manera inmediata la cirugía de Camila.    Nuestro seguro privado nos contestó que apenas
cubriría US$ 500 dólares de total del costo de la cirugía.   Fue por la intervención de
Metrofraternidad que logramos una mayor cobertura, sin embargo aún debemos
sumar una cantidad que para nuestra condición económica es elevada.  El total de la cirugía está fijado en
US$ 11800,00 dólares, de los cuales la mayor parte asume Metrofraternidad.  Con nuestros ahorros aún no falta
completar algo más de US$ 3000 dólares.
Por eso hemos decidido confiar en la generosidad de
amigos y personas que se interesen en ayudar en esta Campaña, para recolectar
el dinero faltante.



CAMPAIGN
The Story:
Our family lives in Quito, the capital of Ecuador in South America.
Over two years ago, we noticed that Camila had difficulties keeping her balance, and in addition she had problems walking.  After a while, she was diagnosed with lypomeningocele, a neural tube defect.  Her condition is further complicated by the fact that her spine is anchored at her lumbar vertebrae's level.
Her condition entails an accumulation of the fatty tissue that supports the spine.  During the normal growth process, her nerves get compressed, causing her feet to deform from her ankles downwards.  This degenerative condition has decalcified her heels bending her feet inwards, causing her to trip when she walks.  In the past few months, the pain has been particularly strong.  After school, Camila needs to stay in bed because she is completely exhausted and in pain.
Camila is a very vital girl, she always liked to participated in play and sports.  In spite of her difficulties, she tries to keep up with the activities of other kids her age.  She always makes her best effort and never gives up.
The solution to this problem is a surgery that will correct the neural tube defect with a prothesis and the spine chord will be detached.  Afterwards, she should receive specialized physiotherapy that will include a second surgery to correct her feet.  
After a long wait, we were not able to find a way to do the surgery at Hospital Baca Ortiz, the children's public hospital in Ecuador (www.hospitalbacaortiz.gov.ec).  Therefore, we decided to go to a private hospital 
(www.hospitalmetropolitano.org).  At this hospital, thanks to Foundation Metrofraternidad  (www.metrofraternidad.org), we were finally able to find an immediate way to finance Camila's surgery.  Our private insurance company only accepted to cover 500 US Dollars of the total cost of the surgery.   Metrofraternidad intervened to cover the major part of the surgery, but the remaining costs are still beyond reach for someone in our economic situation. The surgery costs in total US$ 11800,00, the majority covered by aid from Metrofraternidad. After having used all our savings to cover our share, we still need to add around US$ 3000 more to make the surgery a reality.It is for this reason that we have decided to rely on the generosity of our friends and strangers to help our daughter and collect the funds needed to cover the remaining costs.


EL IMPACTO
La contribución que logremos con esta Campaña
tendrá un significativo impacto en mejorar la calidad de vida de Camila.  Aún luego de la operación debemos
continuar con su rehabilitación hasta lograr que en el transcurso del tiempo
pueda volver a jugar, correr y ser una niña con actividades normales.

THE IMPACT

Your contribution will have a direct impact on improving Camila's quality of life.  After the surgery, we must continue with her rehabilitation so, with time, she is able to play, run and participate in the normal activities for a kid of her age.

LO QUE CAMILA NECESITA
Lo que logremos recaudar en esta Campaña se
destinará íntegramente a completar la diferencia que debemos pagar por la
cirugía de Camila.  En el caso de
que se recaude un valor superior, lo destinaremos para cubrir con el
tratamiento de fisioterapia y si es necesario una nueva cirugía reconstructiva
de los pies de Camila.
Todas las personas que de una u otra forma apoyen
la Campaña, recibirán información permanente de la recuperación de Camila.

WHAT CAMILA NEEDS

All the money obtained in this campaign will be will be used in full to pay for balance for the total cost of the surgery.  In the event that we raise more than $3,000, any exceeding amount will be used to finance the  physiotherapy treatment and, if needed, the second surgery to reconstruct Camila's feet.
Everyone who contributes will get permanent updates on Camila's recovery.

OTRAS FORMAS DE APOYAR LA CAMPAÑA
Además de la generosa contribución  en dinero, las personas que deseen
pueden difundir la Campaña a través de redes sociales como Facebook, Twitter o MySpace.   También pueden compartir el enlace vía correo electrónico a sus amigos y personas dispuestas a ayudar.
www.indiegogo.com/camila

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

You can help us not only by generously donating money, but by spreading the word.  Please share our cause on Facebook, Twitter, MySpace, or any other social media.  You can also email this link to your friends or relatives.
www.indiegogo.com/camila
 
GRACIAS
POR PERMITIR QUE CAMILA ¡CORRA DE NUEVO!
THANKS FOR HELPING CAMILA RUN AGAIN!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Michael Meierholtz. 5 years ago, my wife Melissa was diagnosed with acute kidney failure less than a year after giving birth to our beautiful son. Life changed. She began dialysis treatment at a local clinic but was determined to not let it interfere with her life. Not able to work, she decided it was time to go back to college to pursue a degree in Healthcare Management. In October of 2010, we made the decision to do dialysis in the comfort of our home in order to keep her as healthy as possible. We have rearranged our schedules and developed a new sense of normal. 

Earlier this year, we traveled to MUSC for a kidney transplant. She underwent the operation on a Wednesday morning but the kidney failed and had to be removed the next day. Although dissapointing, we continue to be optimistic.

We are leaning on the promise of the Lord that he will lead us through this and bring us out the other side stronger. My wife is taking college courses while actively volunteering at our sons elementary school. She devotes most of her time to being an awesome mother and a loving wife. The expenses have only just begun as we await a successful transplant.

What We Need & What You Get

We are only asking for 100 pennies from each person that looks at this. The cost of healthcare continues to rise. We are looking to raise $10,000 to go toward current medical bills and the transplant procedure we are sure is coming soon. The money will also be used for other expenses incurred such as medicines, insurance and traveling to MUSC for clinic visits.

The Impact

Everyone has a story. This one is ours that we hope to continue for many years. They say one person can change the world. Maybe Melissa will when she enters the heatlthcare management world to change it for future generations.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word on twitter, facebook, pinterest or whatever forum you frequent. Organ donation is the greatest gift you can give.

story:
I know there are so many valuable causes out there but please help me get the care this U.S. Air Force Veteran needs. Thank you so much for learning about my good friend Teresa.

My friend of 25 years needs your help. Teresa served in the Air Force during the Vietnam War and is currently afflicted with a condition called Hyperparathyroidism.  This disease eventually causes Osteoporosis.  She currently has the following debilitating symptoms that make it very difficult to function, including: short term memory problems, chronic fatigue, sleeplessness, bone pain, depression, and kidney stones. The only treatment to cure this disease is a very specialized surgery called a Parathyroidectomy.

Teresa is a single woman, 57 years old, who has fallen on hard times, as many people have. This disease makes it very difficult to work although she continues every day with a smile on her face. She is an amazing, smart, and loving person who has a job she loves as it helps others, but unfortunately it doesn't pay well and does not give her any health insurance.  She is living in a good friend’s home currently just to make ends meet. Even though she has pain every day, she never complains, but struggles to keep going without savings or outside support. Without this surgery, she will soon lose the ability to work. She has the VA for other health issues that may arise, but the VA does not cover the cost of this unique type of surgery nor do they have a surgeon that specializes in this very delicate, tricky type of surgery.

The Norman Parathyroid Center has a clinic in Tampa, Florida with a 99% cure rate and only specializes in Parathyroidectomies thus reducing the possibility of having to have on-going surgeries for the same problem (a common problem with traditional parathyroid surgeries).

The entire surgical costs are $11,250 and with the cost of air, hotel and meals she will need $12,000 total, an overwhelming and insurmountable cost for her current situation. Her health is steadily getting worse, so time is of the essence.

I know there are so many valuable causes out there but please help me to get her the care she so urgently needs. Even a few dollars could make all the difference. Anything you can give would be so gratefully appreciated.  If you are unable to contribute financially, would you please pass this message on to your email, facebook, twitter, linkedin, etc...friends?  It would be a huge help.  This campaign is for 45 days as she needs the surgery as soon as possible.

Thank you and bless you.

I have put a video on to explain this disease...I hope you will take 6 mins. to watch it. If you have a little more time, please visit their website for more information about the disease and why it's important to have the surgery done by a specialist. Thank you.

story: My mother was diagnosed with stage four colon and liver cancer in Spetember 2011. She has fought very strongly. The docotors took her off chemo deciding it was doing more harm than good. The pills necesary to keep her comfortable as well as hospital visits are extrememly expensive and her insurance wont cover it all. This is to help raise money to pay for my mothers medical bills.
story_txt: My mother was diagnosed with stage four colon and liver cancer in Spetember 2011. She has fought very strongly. The docotors took her off chemo deciding it was doing more harm than good. The pills necesary to keep her comfortable as well as hospital visits are extrememly expensive and her insurance wont cover it all. This is to help raise money to pay for my mothers medical bills.

story:
We are trying to raise money for his medical bills, ongoing treatments, and living expenses. Over the past few years the medical bills have added up and insurence doesnt cover all of that.


Monday, April 26, 2010  my stepdad's(Mike Brost) brain tumor: He is at HCMC and has 2 tumor the size of a golf balls in the front of the head right by his eyes. We just found out my stepdad will have to have 2 surgeries most likely 3 brain surgeies but the outlook is good so far. 1 surgey to drain the fluid and the other to to remove both of the tumors. Everything is in God's hands, please keep your prayers coming!! My family and I appreciate all the prayers and help. We are truly blessed to have all you amazing people.

April 7,2011
Update fourth surgery  it was a10 hour surgery. It was done Thursday April 7, 2011 they got 97percent of the tumor but is having complications from the surgery.He also suffered a silent stroke on the right side of his brain. I will be updating the journal as soon aouple million dollars and s we find out new information.

If you have any question feel free to email us at shoshobeanrose@yahoo.com or 9528184276

April 23, 2011
Thank you all for your love and support. If anyone wants to visit mike he is in HCMC Knapp Rehabilition Part of the hospital.

June 1, 2011 mike is home and looking for a new facility to fit his memory lost needs

 

June 12, 2011 Mike is at

 Robbinsdale Rehabilitation & Care 3131 France Avenue North Robbinsdale, MN 55422 Phone  (763) 588-0771 http://www.robbinsdaleskillednursing.com/

 

Written Sep 12, 2011

We had last care meeting today at mikes memory lost facility today after tomorrow he will be coming home for good. He will go to a adult day care program Monday through Friday 830-4. The adult day care program is called Rise its in the golden valley courage center but not apart of the courage center. He will be taking metro mobility to the Rise program. The doctors wants us to do a test run by doing every other day on the sodium spray to see how much the gland in his brain is working. He will be following up at least once of week with our family doctor on excelsior to keep on his sodium levels.
 
 

Written Apr 7, 2012 3:51pm

It has been a year from his last surgery and lost his short term memory from the second round of surgeries . Mike has made so much progress but the surgeon said it will be years before he gets his memory back and maybe not all of it but he is doing great! He is still going to the courage center in golden valley everyday. we met with the endocrinologist this week and he said his salt levels are under control with his medication he is on but his glucose levels were way to high. He has a big blood test that goes back 3 months and if it says all the three months are high he has diabetes along with already having diabetes insipidus.

 

We want to thank all of you for your love and support from the first of the four surgeries starting 3 years ago . We want to you all to know how much your support has helped mike and our family thank you all

 

Written Oct 20, 2012 2:33pm

Things are going pretty good he has his diabetes mellitus and diabetes insipidus pretty well under control. Mike just got his drivers license back but he has to have someone in the car with him and short distances. He was diagnosed just this past month with sleep apnea so now he has a machine that helps him breathe at night. He finished one of his memory loss programs called CRP at the courage center but he is still in the Raise program at the courage center MWF. He is starting vocational training and testing. With in the next month we have a few more doctors appointments plus a brain MRI so updates will be posted then. If you have any questions feel free to ask. We also wanted to thank you again  for all your love and support!

 

Written Apr 2, 2013 9:37pm

Mike is doing good we got good news no change in the part of the tiny tumor left in the brain mri and doesnt have to see the neurosurgeon for another year. We have his diabetes mellitus and diabetes insipidus under control (fingers crossed) He got a part time job working with Goodwill Easter Sales as a work training program and his bosses loves him. His work training program ends april 12. He then will start to work with a job coach learning how to function on a job work site, interviewing skills and so on. He still goes to the courage center for ongoing treatment and how to relearn everyday skills.  If you have any questions feel free to send us an email to shoshana and nathaniel at shoshobeanrose@yahoo.com

We also wanted to thank you again  for all your love and support!

We have his diabetes mellitus and diabetes insipidus under control (fingers crossed) He got a part time job working with Goodwill Easter Sales as a work training program and his bosses loves him. His work training program ends april 12. He then will start to work with a job coach learning how to function on a job work site, interviewing skills and so on. He still goes to the courage center for ongoing treatment and how to relearn everyday skills.  If you have any questions feel free to send us an email to shoshana and nathaniel at shoshobeanrose@yahoo.com

story:
Short Summary

Mandi Hayes is a published writer and trained vocalist who, aside from hospital visits, has spent the last two years confined to her home. She's been diagnosed with over two dozen disorders, including Lupus and Multiple Sclerosis.




Mandi at the Piano (note she's wearing a wig here)

 

Now she and her husband Toby cannot pay her medical bills. Her severe physical health issues cause frequent trips to the hospital. Dissociation, amnesia, and PTSD have forced in-patient stays in mental institutions. She's spent most of her life from 8/24/10 to the present in a total of seven hospitals, including a psychiatric hospital during a high-risk pregnancy. Her medications have caused her to lose her hair three times:




Mandi’s Hair Loss

And as of the end of January, she now has been diagnosed with blood poisoning thanks to two of the over 15 medications she's currently taking.

As anyone who has experienced a medical emergency or a long-term illness knows, healthcare in this country isn't cheap. Insurance premiums alone have skyrocketed in the last few years.

Mandi needs help. But she isn't asking for a handout. That isn't who she is. She's willing to offer her greatest talents, writing and her voice, to those who contribute to this campaign.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The campaign goal is $3000. That's a huge amount, but Mandi and Toby actually owe over $7000 right now (ETA: It's now over $10,000) to more than a dozen doctors and hospitals. And every little bit helps, which is why this is a flexible campaign. Whatever is raised will go directly toward Mandi's medical bills, even if it's just $5. I'm hoping we can raise $3000, but it would be even more awesome if we could pay off their bills completely!

So what do you get out of this?

That's up to you! Depending on how much you can contribute, you'll receive a mix of poetry, fiction, music, and more.

While in the hospital, Mandi has been working on a memoir that will discuss not only the events which led to her amnesia and her hopes to slowly regain her memory, but also the state of health care in general. She's witnessed firsthand the stories of those who need help but are often denied it due to insurance companies, lack of competent doctors, and financial struggles. But mostly, she's writing the memoir to help a lost girl regain her memory due to trauma beyond her control.

Anyone who contributes at least $25 will have the option of receiving a digital copy of her memoir once it is completed, and will be acknowledged in the memoir.

Also up for grabs: poetry, short stories by Mandi as well as Carrie, her best friend and recent graduate of an MFA program in fiction writing, MP3s of Mandi singing, and videos of Mandi performing for the higher contributors.

If you want a sample of Mandi's writing, check out the gallery section for PDFs of one of her poems, a piece of flash fiction, and an "introduction" to herself that will appear in some form in her memoir.

UPDATE (with just under two weeks to go):

As a thank-you to everyone who has contributed, Mandi and I will be recording a duet of the song "In His Eyes" from the musical Jekyll & Hyde. This MP3 will be sent to EVERYONE WHO CONTRIBUTES, regardless of your contribution level. Thanks for all the support so far!


The Impact

Your contribution goes directly to defray Mandi's medical bills. There's no cost to produce the campaign rewards (since they're all digital), so every last cent of what we make from this campaign goes to a doctor or a hospital.

What that means is that Mandi and Toby can spend their own money on food and clothing, childcare for their son James, medicine, doctor copays, and continuing mental health treatment for which they are now paying out of pocket.

By contributing, you're helping to relieve Mandi's anxiety about money and creating a more peaceful environment for her physical and mental recovery. Not to mention making it easier for her to focus on her writing!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some of you can’t afford to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.

Spread the word. Make some noise. Like the campaign on Facebook, or share a link on your timeline. Indiegogo makes it easy. You can use their sharing tools to post on a number of different social media sites.

Thank you for whatever you can do to help out. Mandi, Toby, and James will never forget your contribution, and once you read Mandi's work (or hear her sing!), you won't regret spending a penny.



Mandi and James (who is now a year old!)

 

Mandi says thank you on her youtube channel:

http://youtu.be/7Q0JTdmjaoM

She's willing to offer her greatest talents, writing and her voice, to those who contribute to this campaign. What We Need & What You GetThe campaign goal is $3000. That's a huge amount, but Mandi and Toby actually owe over $7000 right now (ETA: It's now over $10,000) to more than a dozen doctors and hospitals. And every little bit helps, which is why this is a flexible campaign. Whatever is raised will go directly toward Mandi's medical bills, even if it's just $5. I'm hoping we can raise $3000, but it would be even more awesome if we could pay off their bills completely!So what do you get out of this?That's up to you! Depending on how much you can contribute, you'll receive a mix of poetry, fiction, music, and more.While in the hospital, Mandi has been working on a memoir that will discuss not only the events which led to her amnesia and her hopes to slowly regain her memory, but also the state of health care in general. She's witnessed firsthand the stories of those who need help but are often denied it due to insurance companies, lack of competent doctors, and financial struggles. But mostly, she's writing the memoir to help a lost girl regain her memory due to trauma beyond her control.Anyone who contributes at least $25 will have the option of receiving a digital copy of her memoir once it is completed, and will be acknowledged in the memoir.Also up for grabs: poetry, short stories by Mandi as well as Carrie, her best friend and recent graduate of an MFA program in fiction writing, MP3s of Mandi singing, and videos of Mandi performing for the higher contributors.
If you want a sample of Mandi's writing, check out the gallery section for PDFs of one of her poems, a piece of flash fiction, and an "introduction" to herself that will appear in some form in her memoir.
UPDATE (with just under two weeks to go):
As a thank-you to everyone who has contributed, Mandi and I will be recording a duet of the song "In His Eyes" from the musical Jekyll & Hyde. This MP3 will be sent to EVERYONE WHO CONTRIBUTES, regardless of your contribution level. Thanks for all the support so far!
The ImpactYour contribution goes directly to defray Mandi's medical bills. There's no cost to produce the campaign rewards (since they're all digital), so every last cent of what we make from this campaign goes to a doctor or a hospital.What that means is that Mandi and Toby can spend their own money on food and clothing, childcare for their son James, medicine, doctor copays, and continuing mental health treatment for which they are now paying out of pocket.By contributing, you're helping to relieve Mandi's anxiety about money and creating a more peaceful environment for her physical and mental recovery. Not to mention making it easier for her to focus on her writing!Other Ways You Can HelpWe know some of you can’t afford to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.Spread the word. Make some noise. Like the campaign on Facebook, or share a link on your timeline. Indiegogo makes it easy. You can use their sharing tools to post on a number of different social media sites.Thank you for whatever you can do to help out. Mandi, Toby, and James will never forget your contribution, and once you read Mandi's work (or hear her sing!), you won't regret spending a penny. Mandi and James (who is now a year old!)
 
Mandi says thank you on her youtube channel:
http://youtu.be/7Q0JTdmjaoM

All the money I raise if at all will go towards Camps, registration fees, Gear and Trips for the sport of Rugby which will enhance my Athletic performance in this Awesome Sport.

IRISH PRIDE 

Half the money will go towards my Club to insure us for a spot in Nationals and travel, entertainment and lodging Fees.

Rugby is the fastest growing sport in America and I truly believe that more people should get to know what rugby is and that is one of the things I want to do within my Rugby career.

I Gladly accept any Contributions, and Thank you in Advance!

story:
We Believe in Saving Lives.

Colon Cancer causes 50,000 preventable deaths a year in the U.S. alone. Current home tests are returned only 30% of the time, meaning up to 70% of potential Colon Cancer cases aren’t diagnosed until it’s too late.


-  Why?  -

Current colon cancer preliminary tests require that a patient needs to find a way to collect their feces, send in the messy sample, and then wait while the sample is analyzed. This process simply doesn’t work, people just aren’t comfortable.

The Colon Cancer Detection Glove changes everything. On top of giving patients a way to collect their feces in the privacy of their own bathroom, the glove also analyzes for blood that indicates further testing is needed. Our glove is so much more than just another test, it’s a life saver.

Now we need your help. Please help us in saving lives by donating today. Your donations will help us build a working prototype of the glove so that patients can get the help they need ASAP.

We are confident that this glove will revolutionize the screening process and drastically decrease the number of deaths caused by colon cancer each year.  We need $30,000 to test and design a prototype so that we can bring our product to market and start saving lives!

story:
Meet my wife Maria....

My name is Armando Alcaraz and I have been married to my AMAZING wife Maria for nearly 21 years.

We met at work.  She was one of our radio dispatchers and I was an officer.  She saved my life one night by getting me backup assistance.   That day I vowed that someday I would marry her. Three months later I asked her to marry me. This October we will celebrate 21 years! We have two wonderful children, Carlo and Amanda, and the four of us have been truly Blessed.

Two years ago, April 2010 Maria awoke with what appeared to be a skin rash.  At first we thought it was the new puppy we had rescued or the new laundry detergent that we had started to use.  It would not turn out to be.  Within 11 weeks, Maria was being hospitalized because her epiglottis could no longer function and she was near death due to an Auto Immune Disease ravaging her body known as Dermato Myositis. She was put on life support by means of a feeding tube and was given a new medication known as Intervenes Immune Globulin Infusion (IVIG) which would save her life. Along with Chemotherapy, High dose Steroids and other lifesaving medications she survived.  

At her worst, she lost the ability to walk, talk, eat and drink.  She had to have a hospital bed at home so that she would not drown in her own stomach contents while sleeping, a wheel chair for mobility and visiting nurses to care for her.  She lost her short term memory, cognitive thought process and partial vision due to steroid induced Glaucoma. The illness nearly took her life.  She went from rock climbing, walking and being fully independent to having to be cared for 24/7 for over seven months.

Specialists in Rheumatology, Neurology, Gastro Intestinal, Neuro- Ophthalmology, and Allergist have seen her.  Due to the rareness of her illness, to date, she has been seen by nearly 175 doctors and specialists, in order for them to have a firsthand look at her signs and symptoms.  Some may never see another case like hers in their careers.

We have had to put our lives on hold and have had to relocate from Houston, Texas to Newtown Square, Pennsylvania, to seek less evasive treatments in medication and a quality of life Maria deserves. She has endured countless hours of physical, occupational and speech therapies.  Her vision has improved and her confidence grows daily.

Although we have insurance our out of pocket cost runs nearly 18% for catastrophic illness.  To date we have incurred nearly 1.5 million in insurance claims.  I am a career employee of 25 years and have had to cash in my retirement, life policies, and both children's college funds.

We have sold our home, our cars, and our household goods and live day by day.  We will continue to fight to give Maria the quality of life she deserves and help find a cure for Myositis and its associated illnesses.

She has shown steady improvements but continues to have regular scheduled appointment, data is collected for case studies and monthly infusions via her Port-A-Cath placed under the skin with a visiting nurse, pump and medication, five days a month 2-5 hours a day.

Although there is no known cure for Myositis, there is a period of remission within two to five years of being diagnosed.

Our goals are to help offset our continued lifetime medical expenses and also, we want to assist others suffering from Myositis, Demato Myositis, Poly Myositis and Juvenile Myositis who may not have the means to cover some of their medical costs, transportation or meals during their recovery process. 

Join us in the help to find a cure and WIN the fight against Myositis.

story: My friend Todd was a huge help to me when I was in school. He didnt see my disability,(Spina Bifida) he saw me for who I am. He was always having fun and being adventureous. He had a great sense of humor and loved everyone. Todd lost his life in a car accident and I would like to remember him and his kind way by setting up this fundraiser to help childrem and young adults with Spina Bifida. I want to pass along a kindness like Todd gave to me.

story:
Introduction

Hi, my name is David Jones. I'm the father of two. Melanie, a teacher’s aid, in Alaska and Mallory, who is working on her BS. I'm also a grandfather to two year old Ryan. I've been married to my wife for 29 years this June. Janet is an OB nurse in the Air Force.

I've been a diabetic since the age of 26 but have only suffered complications in the past two years. It all started with a necrotizing faciitis. Then I became ill with osteomyelitis, which ended with my left foot being amputated. I have also had two retinal bleeding which have caused some sight impairments. This has all lead to and contributed to the End Stage Kidney Failure. I'm currently unable to work due to the peritoneal dialysis daily regiment and as of April 4th been expected and placed on the Kidney Transplant list waiting for a new Kidney.

Contributions raised by this campaign will go to subsidize the cost not covered by insurance, such as, travel to the out of state facility in Utah, extended room and board and living expenses for myself and family.

Contributions will help ease the financial burden associated with the transplant surgery.

What We Need & What You Get

Raising $10,000 for:

  • Travel expense to and from Transplant Center in Utah
  • Room and Board at extent end stay facility for myself and family
  • Living expenses

Contributors of certain amounts will receive a handcrafted writing pen or pencil made from a variety of domestic and exotic woods, burls and acrylics by David or Janet.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people will not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out and share this site with your friends.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.
  • Pray

story:
This campaign is closed. You were probably trying to get to our Agua4All - Coachella, Kern and Beyond   campaign, which is just a click away. Thank you for your continued support!

Although we did not reach our ultimate goal, we did in fact raise more than half, allowing us to provide infrastructure for two water bottle filling stations (TAPS). And, we are very happy to report that the TAPS were delivered to Pueblo Unido CDC for the San Jose Community Learning Center. Stay tuned for more news from the valley!

To learn more about the overall Agua4All year-long pilot please go to:http://www.rcac.org/agua4all

Also, don’t forget to connect with RCAC on Facebook at:https://www.facebook.com/RCAC.organd Twitter at: https://twitter.com/RCACorg

No matter who you are or where you live, you should be able to drink a glass of water in your home or neighborhood and not worry that it will make you sick. But this isn’t reality for more than a million Californians, including Eastern Coachella Valley residents, whose water isn’t safe to drink.

With your generous donation, Rural Community Assistance Corporation (RCAC) will provide plumbing infrastructure (everything from pipes to permits) to install two water bottle filling stations (taps) at the San Jose Community Learning Center in Eastern Coachella Valley. This infrastructure will connect two existing taps to a water treatment system that filters out contaminants so that residents will finally have access to potable water. (One of the buildings has bathrooms but no access to water for drinking.) Reusable bottles will be made available. After installation we will raise community awareness about the health benefits of drinking water through outreach and educational materials.

The San Jose Community Learning Center was made possible through a community-driven initiative and provides an important space for adult and youth education classes, meetings and events, and other resident services.

RCAC is partnering  with The California Endowment (TCE) in Health Happens Here #Agua4All, an innovative year-long pilot to increase access to and boost consumption of safe drinking water in Kern County and the Eastern Coachella Valley. Our goal is to expand our project statewide to ensure rural communities throughout California have access to safe drinking water.

Pueblo Unido Community Development Corporation, a local organization, will provide on-the-ground support during the pilot.

With your help, we will raise $10,500 for the infrastructure to install two water bottle filling stations (taps) at the San Jose Community Learning Center in fall 2014 to increase safe drinking water access for neighborhood residents. Your donation will help us bridge the gap between the water source and the filling stations at the center. Here is a breakdown of where your funds will go:

Agua4All addresses two significant public health concerns: free access to safe drinking water and increased water consumption; both of which will increase up to 14,000 local residents’ overall health.

Residents currently do not have easy access to safe drinking water at home or at the learning center. Their tap water contains high levels of arsenic, a highly toxic element. A well at the center holds treated water, but there isn’t any infrastructure to transport the water to the taps. Because of your donation the community will finally have access to potable water.

Arsenic and your health

According to the World Health Organization, long-term arsenic consumption can cause cancer and skin lesions. Arsenic consumption also has been associated with developmental defects, cardiovascular disease, neurotoxicity and diabetes.

Obesity and diabetes

In addition, limited water access increases the risk for obesity and diabetes, because the nearest and most affordable drink is usually a sugary beverage. In a recent California Health Interview Survey, 58 percent of Eastern Coachella Valley children drank sugar-sweetened beverages the day before the survey was administered, as compared to just 40 percent of children surveyed statewide. Further, in Coachella Valley more than 16 percent of children are already overweight and 37 percent are obese, according to the Health Assessment Resource Center.

Your contributions' ultimate benefits

Access to safe drinking water, plus education about the health benefits of drinking water, will help residents improve their health, which ultimately leads to a better quality of life.

If we don't raise enough money

If we are unable to reach our campaign goal, we will continue to seek funds to make this project happen. However, it will delay these residents' access to safe drinking water. We also may not be able to provide reusable water bottles to the community or provide the necessary education needed to change the community's perception on drinking water. Or, we may only be able to install one tap, which limits the community’s access to clean drinking water.

We know not everyone has the resources to contribute money to our campaign but there are other ways you can help. Spread the word. Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and other social media. Tell your friends and family about our Agua4All campaign.  

Founded in 1978, Rural Community Assistance Corporation (RCAC) provides technical assistance, training and financing so rural communities achieve their goals and visions. We serve 13 western states and the Pacific Islands. For nearly four decades, we have funded and guided sustainable projects in the areas of clean water; environmental infrastructure; affordable housing and leadership and economic development. Learn more: www.rcac.org 

The California Endowment (TCE) is a private, statewide health foundation with a mission to expand access to affordable, quality health care for underserved individuals and communities, and to promote fundamental improvements in the health status of all Californians.  Learn more: www.calendow.org

Pueblo Unido Community Development Corporation (PUCDC) is a nonprofit organization born from the initiative of community leaders with extensive experience and knowledge of local issues and concerns in rural areas of the Coachella Valley. Learn more: www.pucdc.org

Special thanks to:

Regional Access Project (RAP) Foundation – provided a generous donation to PUCDC to support this campaign. This donation provided us with the funds needed to get started on the first tap.  -- http://www.regionalaccessproject.org/

Beacon’s Point – produced and edited the video -- www.beaconspoint.com

Elkay – provided discounted water bottle filling stations -- www.elkay.com

Klean Kanteen – provided discounted water bottles -- www.kleankanteen.com

story:
Short Summary

Hello  and thank you so much for visiting our page! We are raising funds for the Crossfit KFOR (Kosovo Force) located at Camp Bondsteel, Kosovo.  This crossfit box is open and available for anyone currently stationed there, all NATO forces not just US troops.  They have had athletes from Poland, Germany, and other countries. They hold events such as the annual Memorial Day Murph. It is a non-profit Crossfit military affiliate.  Since no one is charged monthly fees, all the equipment has been acquired through generous donations and athletes purchasing their own gear. 

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down folks:

  • Crossfit KFOR is in desperate need of new bumper plates and kettle bells, as well as things like jump ropes, resistance bands, ab mats, etc. 
  • All money raised will go to purchasing and shipping new gear from Rogue to Kosovo.
  • For your donation, you can choose from multiple perks or donate perk-free so all of your donation goes to buying equipment. 
The following equipment has been requested by the current KFOR rotation:
  1. Pairs of bumper plates (10, 15, 25, 45)
  2. Kettle bells (2 of each 26, 35, 44, and 53 lbs)
  3. Two sets of resistance bands (red, blue, and green)
  4. Med balls (2 of each 10, 14, and 20 lbs)
  5. Speed ropes
  6. Ab mats
We are trying to raise this money quickly so that the heavy equipment can be shipped with the incoming rotation. Thank you for your help!

The Impact

Crossfit is a community.  While soldiers are away from home, family and friends, it helps to have a piece of that home with them.  For many that piece of home is Crossfit.  We seek to make their box away from home the best it can be.  With your contribution we can do that.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help out by sharing our campaign with everyone you know! Facebook, Twitter, Everybody!
story_txt:
Short Summary Hello  and thank you so much for visiting our page! We are raising funds for the Crossfit KFOR (Kosovo Force) located at Camp Bondsteel, Kosovo.  This crossfit box is open and available for anyone currently stationed there, all NATO forces not just US troops.  They have had athletes from Poland, Germany, and other countries. They hold events such as the annual Memorial Day Murph. It is a non-profit Crossfit military affiliate.  Since no one is charged monthly fees, all the equipment has been acquired through generous donations and athletes purchasing their own gear.    What We Need & What You Get Breaking it down folks: 
Crossfit KFOR is in desperate need of new bumper plates and kettle bells, as well as things like jump ropes, resistance bands, ab mats, etc.  
 All money raised will go to purchasing and shipping new gear from Rogue to Kosovo.

For your donation, you can choose from multiple perks or donate perk-free so all of your donation goes to buying equipment.  
The following equipment has been requested by the current KFOR rotation:


Pairs of bumper plates (10, 15, 25, 45)
Kettle bells (2 of each 26, 35, 44, and 53 lbs)
Two sets of resistance bands (red, blue, and green)
Med balls (2 of each 10, 14, and 20 lbs)
Speed ropes
Ab mats

We are trying to raise this money quickly so that the heavy equipment can be shipped with the incoming rotation. Thank you for your help!

  The Impact Crossfit is a community.  While soldiers are away from home, family and friends, it helps to have a piece of that home with them.  For many that piece of home is Crossfit.  We seek to make their box away from home the best it can be.  With your contribution we can do that.
  Other Ways You Can Help 
Please help out by sharing our campaign with everyone you know! Facebook, Twitter, Everybody!

story:
My name is Johanna Roberts.  I'm a 33 year old disabled woman who suffers from Lupus and Fibro.  I live on a fixed income and recently found out that I need to have the rest of my teeth extracted and get dentures to replace them.


The dentures alone, not including the cost of extraction, are four thousand dollars.  The reason for the higher goal on here is to also cover the surgery since medicare does not.


I normally would not be asking for money like this except for the amount of pain I'm in daily because of my teeth.  It aggravates the fibro and leaves me bedridden more days than usual.  I've also been told by both dentists and regular doctors that having the extractions done will likely greatly improve my health.


I normally would not ask for money like this and in this amount but I need to have this surgery done and then get the dentures so I can close the book on this chapter of my life and hopefully improve my health.


Update:  Yesterday I had to go to the ER due to the pain this causes, and the extreme pain is becoming more and more constant.  I can not stress enough that I need this done soon.  Thank you so much to those of you who already donated and to those of you who will.

story:
I am a 9 year breast cancer survivor and a member of the "Against the Wind" BCS Dragon Boat Team. We earned a slot at the 9th Club Crew World Championships in Ravenna, Italy. This trip is fully funded by my team individually. 

I have been a long time athlete and was told after my surgery that I had lymphedema in my right arm and there were many things I would no longer be able to do. That is just not true.

I have been a member of this team since May of 2013 when I found out about them at the Komen Philadelphia Race for the Cure. My lymphedema has improved not gotten worse and the camaraderie and the support I receive from my teammates is the most rewarding part of the experience. 

We are all survivors and range in age from 25 - 80. Strong proud women that prove every day that our competitive spirit is still there after breast cancer.

These funds will be used totally to fund my trip to Italy and can be paid directly to the travel agent handling our travel.

I have attached a vidoe of our team in action. Look at us go.....

"When you push off from the dock...we're all in the same boat. This isn't about cancer anymore. It's about exercise and health and the rest of your life. When we push off we're paddling away from breast cancer."
Dr. Don McKenzie Founder, Abreast in a Boat — world's 1st BCS dragon boat team

Get the word out about Dragon Boating to other cancer survivors. There are lots of teams out there now but we could use a lot more competition.

Please remember to use your Indiegogo share tools and THANK YOU for your support!

story:
The Balluga Bed has already been featured in the following publications:

• Digital Trends - "Easily the smartest bed we’ve seen yet... stupid beds have plenty to worry about."

• The Verge - "Feeling parts of the bed stiffen and relax underneath my limbs convinced me that this would be a very useful feature if you’re at all mattress-sensitive."

• International Business Times - "Trouble sleeping? Balluga smart bed 'with a brain' could banish those sleepless nights."

There’s normally more than one contributing factor to a good night’s sleep. If you have ever had a bad night’s sleep from being too hot or cold or suffered from back pain from an unsupportive mattress, or even been woken up by a partner snoring, Balluga is for you.

Balluga creates your ideal sleeping conditions to provide you with your best night’s sleep, every night. Balluga is the first truly smart bed that manages your total sleep experience in real-time, by monitoring your body’s vital statistics and adjusting its firmness, support and temperature to match your chosen settings throughout the night.

Balluga’s patented layers of air spring cells will ensure your bed remains as new and will not compress or sag over time. No more rolling into the middle dip of the bed, or hanging onto the sides of your mattress.

Balluga's design ethos will help to maintain your bedroom's ambiance by integrating all its technology within the bed to ensure it is invisible and silent during use.

Balluga's active suspension system monitors the pressure that your body places in different zones of the mattress. The air pressure is automatically increased or decreased in each zone, to ensure that your body and spine are always correctly supported.

Our unique suspension allows you to sleep on your back, side or front with equal comfort by reducing pressure under the heaviest parts of your body while providing additional support to its lightest parts.

Balluga's individual air cells are soft enough not to restrict healthy blood circulation while providing firm support for your entire body. Our hybrid mattress design of air cells and supporting foam layers ensures that our mattresses look and feel like any high quality mattress while providing an advanced computer monitored and controlled suspension system.

Balluga's suspension allows you to alter the firmness of your mattress every time you use it. This feature is available to use independently for each side of our double mattresses.

A steady stream of air will keep your body at its optimum temperature throughout the night. Individual temperature levels can be set for each side of the mattress so no more arguing with your partner about who might be hogging the sheets, or waking up to kick them off.

The cool side of the pillow has never felt so good! 

Balluga's real time sleep monitoring can help you relax and fall asleep faster and wake you up at a pre set time. By learning your sleep habits, it can help maximize the quality and depth of your sleep, as well as prevent any sleep interruptions over time.

All the vital statistics attained by Balluga bed can be integrated with other sleep apps on your smartphones, tablets and wearable devices. We're planning to work with a number of third party hardware developers to allow Balluga beds to interact in real time with other smart IOT home products like thermostats, lights, smoke alarms and locks.

 

  Motion Activated Multicolored Ambient Lighting

Balluga Demo Live on UK Television April 2014

Air Circulation Demonstration

Thermal View of Heating & Cooling

We believe everyone is entitled to the best night's sleep that modern technology and design can offer and we have been developing Balluga for over seven years to make that possible.

We have reached the fully working, market ready product stage and had a successful Kickstarter campaign to allow us to bring Balluga beds into full production and into people's bedrooms worldwide.

We are are now very excited to bring Balluga to Indiegogo InDemand to allow others to support us at some new pledge levels. We would love to hear your feedback, so please get in touch and tell us what you think! 

The effects of lack of sleep to our mind and body on a day-to-day basis are cumulative. In one study, people who slept for six hours a night for two weeks performed as poorly on cognitive tests as those who stayed up for 24 hours. That holds true even if you don't feel particularly sleepy.

Balluga mattresses and bases are manufactured from a combination of natural and man made materials. They are all selected to be non allergenic and anti bacterial to deter any bacterial or bed bug infestation. All of our mattresses will comply with regional sleeping certifications and standards to ensure the highest level of hygienic sleeping conditions.

Balluga’s built in technology is inaccessible by design and is fused and insulated for ultimate safety. All the mattress, bed base controls and monitoring sensors run on 12V DC. The heating elements which are safely sealed within the bed base run on mains power. They are triple fused and triple insulated for optimum safety.

The Balluga sleep monitoring and operating systems have very low energy consumption as each feature of the mattress or base is normally operated for a limited amount of time throughout the night.

The maximum power loading if all the sleep features are operated simultaneously will not exceed 100W, while the heating elements can consume up to 1400W when the heating function is engaged. During normal use, only a fraction of the maximum energy output is utilised for a few seconds or minutes depending on the functions used.

Balluga beds have a 10 year limited warranty for all mattresses and bases which covers all materials, components and workmanship subject to normal wear and tear. This limited Warranty extends to the original purchaser and not to any third party.

Balluga mattresses must be used normally for their intended purposes and on a bed base that is level flat and structurally capable of supporting the weight of the Mattress and its user(s).

Balluga’s limited warranty does not cover any physical abuse or damage to the structure and/or cover material, including but not limited to, misuse, burns, cuts, tears, liquid damage, or stains; provided, that the defect is caused by such abuse or damage.

The Balluga Bed concept has been in development for over seven years as our founder Joe Katan was frustrated by sleeping on sagging and non-adjustable mattresses. There was nothing on the market that was able to resolve these and other issues so Joe decided to take on the challenge of developing a bed that could.

  • 2010: Late in 2010 he assembled a proof of principle vertical air cell unit
  • 2011:  He moulded an air diaphragm and linked a group of vertical air cells to test the principle as an independent zone to support a larger body of weight
  • 2012 - 2013: working with designers and software engineers, the first two single bed prototypes were created 
  • 2014: a hybrid design of air cells and layers of supporting foam was conceived to improve the design.

Balluga continues to developed its own suspension and other technologies and has patents granted and others pending worldwide. 

The Balluga name and brand is a registered trade mark in territories worldwide.

Set up is very simple, you could do it in your sleep! There are 3 simple steps which will take less than five minutes:  

1. Unpack the mattress and plug it into a power socket

2. Download the Balluga App

3. Open the App and the mattress will automatically inflate and be ready to use in about 5 minutes.

4. The bed base is either made up of 2 or parts depending on size and takes about 10 minutes to assemble.

 

Balluga Bed bases are available in either our Concept design shown in our video or our Classic free standing base design which can be fitted into existing bed frames just like a drop-in box spring unit. It can also be used independently as shown in the animation video below. Mattress & Base backers will be asked to select which of the two base designs they wish to order.

 

During our launch phase, we have manufacturing partners in China who are able to produce and distribute our products worldwide. Our design and development team is based in the UK and our long term mission is to establish local assembly and distribution centers across our key markets.

The mattresses and bed bases will be delivered via international couriers. The mattress will arrive vacuum packed in one box and the bed bases will arrive in 2 to 4 boxes depending on the size of the bed chosen.

As the inventor of the Balluga bed, Joe has overseen specialist teams of industrial designers and software engineers to develop a number of prototypes over the last 7 years to reach this launch stage.

With your support he hopes to bring the many benefits of the Balluga bed to consumers worldwide and provide them with their best night's sleep night after night.

Jason is focused on helping the company grow into a successful brand. Over the past 15 years, Jason has been working with start-up businesses in the IT sector, helping them to develop and grow. He has worked with multiple software companies and has experience in engineering, project management and IT. Jason has also led highly successful marketing campaigns via digital and traditional channels.

Justyna is responsible for the management of our product development systems. She has experience in project coordination & development, multidisciplinary analysis and feasibility studies. Justyna also has experience in managing mechanical, electrical, power engineering and environmental research.

Balluga's suspension allows you to alter the firmness of your mattress every time you use it. This feature is available to use independently for each side of our double mattresses.



Control the firmness of your mattress with an App




A steady stream of air will keep your body at its optimum temperature throughout the night. Individual temperature levels can be set for each side of the mattress so no more arguing with your partner about who might be hogging the sheets, or waking up to kick them off.
The cool side of the pillow has never felt so good! 



Independent temperature control for each side of the bed.




Our pressure point vibro massage system will relax your muscles and allow you to drift to sleep or gently vibrate to wake you up in the morning. The massage system can also be preset to automatically shut down at a number of preset times.



 Balluga's Vibro Massage System



Our App is compatible for use on iOS and Android smartphones or tablets. Alternatively you can control the bed using our wireless touch screen control unit. Through our app, your preferred comfort and therapeutic settings can be saved and used on any other Balluga Bed worldwide. 









App pages for Firmness, Massage & Temperature control 



Our integrated sleep monitoring sensors are able to obtain a number of your vital statistics like your body temperature, heart rate and  even your room temperature. All this data can be analyzed and passed on to our active air suspension, temperature control and vibro massage systems, to automatically adjust them in real time to create your ideal sleep experience.

Balluga's real time sleep monitoring can help you relax and fall asleep faster and wake you up at a pre set time. By learning your sleep habits, it can help maximize the quality and depth of your sleep, as well as prevent any sleep interruptions over time.
All the vital statistics attained by Balluga bed can be integrated with other sleep apps on your smartphones, tablets and wearable devices. We're planning to work with a number of third party hardware developers to allow Balluga beds to interact in real time with other smart IOT home products like thermostats, lights, smoke alarms and locks.



Monitor your sleep cycles via the Balluga app



Balluga's anti-snoring technology will save you from being kept awake, or being kicked awake! Balluga's built in sound sensor will automatically detect the sound wave patterns of snoring. The air suspension sections below your head will then raise or lower your pillow until the snoring has stopped. This established method of varying the head position without interrupting sleep could be a marriage saving feature - you can thank us later!
 


Triggered Automatically by the Sound of Snoring



Our external movement sensor and built in LED lighting system can provide you with night-time illumination for when you need to get up in the dark of night. They will help you eliminate those painful toe-stubbing moments, or tripping over a sleeping pet. The LED lights can also be set to illuminate in a number of colors.
  Motion Activated Multicolored Ambient Lighting





Balluga Demo Live on UK Television April 2014

Air Circulation Demonstration

Thermal View of Heating & Cooling

story:
**** For questions about shipping or anything else, see our FAQ's (Facts and Questions) at the bottom of the page. ****
 
             

                            

Meddy's Mission is to help kids around the world lead healthier, more loving lives through yoga, meditation, and mindfulness practices.

The secret is out: scientific studies abound that support yoga and mindfulness have very real and measurable positive effects on young minds and bodies. To name a few:

  • Improves academic performance, learning & memory
  • Improves self-control
  • Reduces anger, anxiety and depression
  • Increases self-esteem
  • Improves social skills, respect for others                           

                 

⬆ #YogaWithMeddy Instagram Challenge ⬆

 

 

 

 

How do we create a better place for our children and our children’s children? The answer may not be simple, but one thing is clear. We have to start now. We have to start with the children of today and teach healthy habits that will benefit the children of tomorrow. 

 

 

 

Meddy Teddy helps parents and teachers broach big topics like mindfulness, self-trust, and peacefulness—just to name a few—in a way that kids find accessible and fun. And Yoga is a perfect low-impact, gateway to fitness that can teach kids the importance of flexibility, muscle development and positive body image.

 

          

Meddy Teddy is proud to announce a partnership with Yoga Foster! http://www.yogafoster.org/

                                  

                                   

 

Yoga Foster is a non-profit organization working to help teachers start yoga programs in their classrooms during the school day.Through training, curriculum and yoga mats, teachers teach movement and mindfulness.

 

And it's 100% free for teachers at Title 1 schools! If you support through our $50 level, you'll get a Meddy Teddy AND give one child the gift of yoga for an entire YEAR! 

 

                    

                  

                       

On May 1st, 2016 our 15,000$ goal was hit!!!!!!!! Thank you all so beary beary much!! 

 The love from around the world is so inspiring and encouraging. 

We have 15 days left!!!

Meddy wants to double the raised to 30K, so he can get to everyone faster!

Our most important goal is to use the money we raise to fund our first big round of production for Meddy Teddy. 

Afterwards, create "Meddy Teddy's Mindful Yoga Flow" book and "A Mindful Journey Begins" story book. Once the characters are more developed, we plan to produce a short animated series.

 

 

"If every 8 year old in the world is taught meditation, we will eliminate violence from the world within one generation."

Help us make a major impact in the lives of the children of today and tomorrow.

               

 

 

 

 

 

Please share the small bear with a big message to everyone you think would love a little more mindfulness in their life.

We're still designing the Meddy Totes for the Out and About Perk! Help us design them by leaving votes and and feedback in the comments section!

 

 

 

  

   

 

 

Thank you all so much for helping to get Meddy Teddy out there! Bearmaste.

story:
My name is Belinda L. Collins and I am a fully licensed Cosmetologist. After over 6 years of studying and testing, by Spiritual Inspiration and with a passion in my heart and a vision in my head, I set out to create and develop an effective product line for the health care of natural and relaxed hair. This product line directly address many hair care issues. The products will be coupled with hair care knowledge that will be shared with those interested in the health and well being of their hair.

Years come and years go, but many people still struggle in the area of hair care. Even in today’s time people still yearn and call out for help with taking care of their hair. Many salons are great at hair styles but they tend to fall short when it comes to hair care. Some of the most common and popular hair styles today are also some of the leading causing of many hair care issues. A secondary cause of the hair care struggles of today is a lack of hair care knowledge.

The following is just a few questions people are asking:

Can someone help me with my hair issues? I’m still struggling to find a real solution to your hair issues, do you know of a real solution? I desire to have strong, lustrous healthy hair, are there real products out there that will really work as advertised?

A visual note of some results:                

                             

           Before                                 After (1.5 years)


                                           

            Before                       After (1 month)                    After (3 months)

One of the reasons for hair breakage is attributed to a lack of moisture. Mineral oil, lanolin, and petroleum all sound good but these ingredients are some of the main culprits that attribute to hair shortage and limited growth.

As we need oxygen to breathe; the same is true for our scalp. Lack of oxygen due to weaves, and tight braiding can also lead to breakage and receding hairline.

With a driving passion for the nurturing of hair, I also created a regimen to support the successful line of products. These products are for the lasting healthy growth of natural and relaxed hair for women and men.

KNOWLEDGE IS WISDOM!

We will provide you information on proper techniques that will lead on your best hair care journey.  You will receive better results with using a consistent hair care regimen.

With your support by way of funding this project, we will be able to move to the next stage of progression. With the $7500.00 funding we will complete the following tasks:

1.  Obtain true GS1 barcodes.

2.  Update and complete current and new product labels.

3.  Purchase startup inventory; ingredients and containers.

4.  Purchase automatic product label machines and automatic product filling machines.

5.  Upgrade current website and kick off a social media advertising campaign.

If we exceed the 100% funding amount then the additional funds will go into the development and testing of the next set of products. Depending of the amount of the overage, a hair care blog and series of videos will also be developed.

 

       

                  Before                                             After (6 weeks)

 

In your wisdom of funding this project, the following rewards will be offered:

$10 range: A personalized Thank You.

$25 range: Specialized hair styling tool.

$75 range: Personalized hair care regimen.

$150 range: Hair Resolutions' "Hair Redemption" Leave-In Conditioner or "Hair Seals" 100% Natural Oil.

$300 range: Rewards of all 4 lower ranges.

  $500 or higher: Hair Resolutions' "Hair Fitness" Hair Growth Oil or "Better Control" Deep Moisturizing Conditioner and you will receive two of Hair Resolutions' newest products.


This is a great product line that will solve the hair issues of many who seek it and the added knowledge to lead to long term success. Your funding will go a long way in making this happen. For questions you may have and more information such as the results below is available at www.hairres.com . You may also contact us at https://twitter.com/Hairres411 and http://www.facebook.com/Hairres411  .

                

        Before       After (8 days)                      One Month Progression


                          HAIR RESOLUTIONS IS YOUR SOLUTION!

story:
Garik and Tatul Jilavyans live in a village Koghb, Armenia. Both of them have disabilities and are able to move around only by using motorized wheelchairs. They got their wheelchairs several years ago with the support of Armenian Relief Society. Now the wheelchairs are not serviceable and brothers need new wheelchairs. They need 2 “Go-Go Ultra X 4 Wheel Travel Mobility Scooter” wheelchairs with total cost of 2500 USD.

Garik, 19, is a second year distance learning student at Ijevan branch of Yerevan State University, Department of Programming and Information Technologies. Tatul, 13, studies at secondary school with excellent grades.

Without wheelchair boys have to stay at home, they will be isolated from society, so they need our help to have good education and work opportunities in their community, because they can participate in community life, go to school and to be included in society only by having wheelchair.


Ջիլավյան եղբայրները սայլակների կարիք ունեն

Գարիկ և Թաթուլ Ջիլավյան եղբայրները ապրում են Տավուշի մարզի Կողբ գյուղում: Նրանք հաշմանդամություն ունեն և տեղաշարժվում են մոտորասայլակների միջոցով, որոնք դեռ տարիներ առաջ ձեռք են բերել Հայ օգնության միության աջակցությամբ: Այժմ դրանք օգտագործման երթակա չեն և եղբայրները նոր սայլակների կարիք ունեն: Անհարաժեշտ է «Go-Go Ultra X 4 Wheel Travel Mobility Scooter» 2 սայլակ, որոնց ընդհանուր արժեքը 2500 ԱՄՆ դոլար է։

Գարիկը 19 տարեկան է, սովորում է Երևանի պետական համալսարանի Իջևանի մասնաճյուղի Բնական գիտությունների ֆակուլտետի (Ծրագրավորման և ինֆորմացիոն տեխնոլոգիաների ամբիոն) հեռակա ուսուցման 2-րդ կուրսում: Թաթուլը 13 տարեկան է, նա բարձր առաջադիմությամբ սովորում է Կողբի 1-ին միջնակարգ դպրոցում:

Առանց նոր մոտորասայլակների եղբայրները ստիպված կլինեն մնալ տանը: Նրանք մեր օգնության կարիքն ունեն, որպեսզի կարողանան շարունակել իրենց կրթությունը և աշխատել իրենց մարզում: Միայն համապատասխան անվասայլակ ներ ունենալու դեպքում տղաները կարող են մասնակցել հասարակական կյանքին, գնալ դպրոց, համալսարան և ներառվել հասարակությանը:

story:
Short Summary

This is a one time deal in where we are going to right a wrong and put someone away who truly deserves it, but we NEED YOUR HELP.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • 500.00 US will cover the days lost of employment for Mr. Amos Wallace, so he can go to court to testify against Mr. Raymond Martineau and retrieve his stolen property.
  • You get the satisfaction of knowing that you helped put a person behind bars who is an Habitual Offender and has been deemed such.

Download a unique "Karma Warrior" badge for your 5, or 10 dollar US pledge.

The funds will go to Homeless Recovery in Tampa, if our goal is unmet. They got me back on my feet when I was homeless and I am forever and always grateful to them!

The Impact

This is a personal pledge taken by me. The neighbor who was targeted and had his beloved classic collectible Tampa Bay Buccaneers FootBall Helmet sign stolen is a member of the "lower class", as am I. By chance, his name is Amos Wallace. The video tape shows that on the night in question, which was back in October of 2012, Raymond Martineau stole his sign. Amos wants his original sign back and had Ray arrested. Bond was set at 30,000.00, along with misdemeanor domestic abuse and theft and running from a police officer. It's an old story and Ray has jousted with justice for years and been in and out of prison. 

It's one of the reasons he has this sense of entitlement. After Wade died though (the scenario where it was just Wade and Ray and I still wonder), he's just gotten meaner and more in people's faces and that is bad. Ray needs to go away and he's playing the system. Amos has to take days off of work, without pay.

I propose that WE pay Amos Wallace for any work  days missed in June (about 4-5), so we can put this little psychopath, back behind bars, where he belongs. If possible, I propose to also appear as a character witness.

I'm pretty good with things like this, although I have never done and Indiegogo. The neighbors thought it was a good idea. As we have the crime on tape, I'm not perjuring myself and will testify only to what I've observed.

I was in the homeless shelter when Ray lived there and I can attest to his cold attitude and ways. He never hesitated to run down his girlfriend of the moment when she was not in earshot. He constantly begged for money and if  it wasn't forthcoming, he would berate us as if we should be falling all over ourselves to give him 20 cents. He's broken into people's houses and he stole people's wallets in the shelter. He would steal and sell other people's bus passes and bicycles. He either had the worst luck in the world, or was just that rapacious. I suspect the latter. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I truly understand that folks are strapped and this is a pretty quixotic Indiegogo project. There really is nothing tangible at the end. It's about doing the right thing and undercutting someone who isn't doing that. I have little to offer; just the notion that it is the right thing to do. Oh yeah, and some kind of horrible badge that I will make up and send to anyone who donates anything. Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
