story:
Although breastfeeding even prevents diseases that range from diabetes to cancer, many mothers give up on it since they don’t know if they’ve given their baby enough to eat.

MIM for MOM encourages the natural and healthy process of breastfeeding by measuring in real-time the quantity of breastfed milk in a safe and comfortable manner. Help us make MIM for MOM a reality for babies and mothers all over the world.

What is MIM for MOM?

MIM (Milk in Measure) for MOM is a patent-pending necklace based device that measures in real-time the quantity of breastfed milk in a safe, comfortable, easy-to-use and affordable manner (since it costs less than buying formula milk). It achieves all of this and more while enabling direct contact between a mom and her baby.

 

Why is it Important?

MIM for MOM encourages breastfeeding, which provides babies with irreproducible proteins, nutrients, antibodies and growth factors as well as enhancing brain, immune and gut development. Research shows that for infants not being breastfed results in elevated risks of childhood obesity, diabetes, leukemia and sudden infant death syndrome. For mothers, the lack of breastfeeding is associated with an increased incidence of breast cancer, ovarian cancer, weight gain and diabetes.

 

When is it Useful?

MIM for MOM is very useful:

  • During the first days after birth, spent in the hospital
  • During the first period of time, adjusting at home after the baby is born
  • When mothers need to closely monitor the amount of milk their baby is taking in
  • When getting ready to enroll the baby into a nursery
  • During the adjustment period of changing the baby’s standard diet – such as starting bottle feeding, or introducing solids or weaning from the breast

 

What are its Benefits?

MIM for MOM's benefits include:

  • Enhanced breastfeeding experience – MIM for MOM enhances the experience and quality of breastfeeding for mothers and babies, providing parents with answers to the question: “How much did our baby eat?”
  • Reduces worries and pain – The device helps to reduce both worries and pain of mothers by monitoring breastfeeding in an innovative way that is unlike any other on the market.
  • Tracking appetite and growth – The product allows tracking and recording the baby’s appetite and growth.
  • Assists in breastfeeding management – For instance, it builds a feeding table for single and/or multiple babies. It also indicates feeding/playing periods in a single breastfeeding. MIM for MOM allows managing breastfeeding in a smart way (e.g. more control, better balance, higher comfort and better smooth weaning).
  • Sharing information – MIM for MOM provides information that may be shared online with a spouse, family members or friends.

 

How Does MIM for MOM Work?

MIM for MOM is made up of (i) a necklace-based device and (ii) disposable components, which are the nipple dressings. These dressings are ultra-flat and narrow pads whose unique design enables lactation to be done in a natural manner since there is direct contact between a mom's breasts and her baby's lips and mouth. The mom takes a nipple addressing from a sterile pocket, wears it on her breast/s and breastfeeds the baby. As soon as the lactation ends, she throws the dressing to the trash.

Here’s more detail from one of our team members, Ms. Tali Gassner, who is a Certified Breastfeeding Counselor and a mother of two, on how MIM for MOM works:  

“It is basically an ultra thin strip of silicone-like material that is pressed on the breast covering part of the areola, but with a hole for the nipple. The display is attached to this strip by the necklace (that's the part that does the magic and manages to calculate the amount of milk the baby has gotten out of the breast). The great part is that we can actually show in real-time the amount of milk being nursed out of the breast, but the baby won't feel anything different than if the MIM for MOM weren't there! Only part of the areola is covered (and even that part is covered by an ultra thin layer) so the baby still feels and smells his mom. The nipple is not covered so the milk can flow freely. Each measuring strip comes in a sterile package and is for single use, to ensure the best level of accuracy and cleanliness for mom and baby. With the device we have currently built we reached a level of 97% in the measurement of milk. Once we have this funding, I believe the accuracy will be even higher since we can have the devices built more precisely.”

 

The technology behind this device was developed by Dr. Ofer Melamed, who has a PhD in brain science, is a chemist-physicist and a father of one, over the course of three years. Here's how he explains it:

“Milk is a very complex liquid. The milk density and viscosity vary from mother to mother, from breast to breast. As soon as the milk is ejected from the breast nipple, the temperature surrounding it drops. Measuring such a liquid requires overcoming on the limitations of a very sensitive environment, such as the mouth and nipple. We found a very sophisticated way to measure the flow by using fractional differential pressure gradients on a micro scale.”

 

Dr. Melamed also notes that: “I invented MIM for MOM after my wife and I had our first child and she nearly gave up on breastfeeding.”

 

How Can I Help?

With your support, MIM for MOM will be productized much earlier and thus it will be available to mothers and babies much faster. We expect to be able to deliver by the end of 2013. Thank you in advance for all your help!

 

 

FAQ

In addition to the frequently asked questions below, see our Updates for more questions that people asked us during this campaign.

 

Q: Are the materials permitted by the FDA and/or CE?

A: Definitely. For the safety of the baby, MIM for MOM is made from FDA/CE approved materials. It is the same materials of the bottles and the dummy (pacifier).  

 

Q: Does MIM for MOM put a sensor in the baby’s mouth?

A: No.

 

Q: Does the baby touch the mother's breast?

A: Yes, the baby touches the mother's breast.

 

Q: Does the usage require additional work?

A: No. MIM for MOM is designed in a way that accommodates a very busy mom. She may take a nipple dressing from a sterile pocket, wear it on her breast and breastfeed the baby. As soon as the lactation ends, she throws the dressing to the trash.

 

Q: What are MIM for MOM’s advantages for the short-run?

A: A mother is sure her baby had his or her meal. Mothers reach the optimal positioning for her and the baby. Mothers can plan gradual weaning. Mothers can be relaxed while the baby is eating.

 

Q: What are MIM for MOM’s advantages for the long-run?

A: You will have a track record of your baby’s development.

 

Q. Is MIM for MOM expensive?

A: No. MIM for MOM costs less than buying formula milk.

 

Q: Does MIM for MOM replace the lactation consultant?

A: No. MIM for MOM assists you and the lactation consultant to find the optimal position for your baby and give you immediate confidence.

 

Q: I don’t know if all my babies eat enough.

A: MIM for MOM will generate a full table for you with quantities and amounts.

 

Q: I have a painful breast. How does MIM for MOM help?

A: Pain occurs when wrong nursing management is performed. MIM for MOM may assist in managing your nursing time and quantities.

 

Q: I have a little amount of breastfeed milk. Should I use MIM for MOM?

A: Definitely. A little amount of breastfeed milk incorporates quite large amount of nutrients. You may use MIM for MOM to quantify the amount of milk the baby ate by the breast and complete the meal with formula milk. In this way you keep your ability to produce milk.

 

Q: I am a working mother. How can MIM for MOM help?

A: Working mothers have short time. Using MIM for MOM you hey may have the exact start/end lactation times. They will gain both nursing and work.

 

Q: I would like to wean my baby. How can MIM for MOM help?

A: The most important guideline for weaning is a gradual reduction. The gradual reduction will prevent the mother from pain and prevent shock for the baby. MIM for MOM can allow you track the time and the amount of breastfeeding.

 

Q: May I rely on the accuracy of MIM for MOM?

A: Definitely. MIM for MOM is highly reliable at up to 97% accuracy.
story_txt:
Although breastfeeding even prevents diseases that range from diabetes to cancer, many mothers give up on it since they don’t know if they’ve given their baby enough to eat.
MIM for MOM encourages the natural and healthy process of breastfeeding by measuring in real-time the quantity of breastfed milk in a safe and comfortable manner. Help us make MIM for MOM a reality for babies and mothers all over the world.

What is MIM for MOM? 
MIM (Milk in Measure) for MOM is a patent-pending necklace based device that measures in real-time the quantity of breastfed milk in a safe, comfortable, easy-to-use and affordable manner (since it costs less than buying formula milk). It achieves all of this and more while enabling direct contact between a mom and her baby.

 
Why is it Important?
MIM for MOM encourages breastfeeding, which provides babies with irreproducible proteins, nutrients, antibodies and growth factors as well as enhancing brain, immune and gut development. Research shows that for infants not being breastfed results in elevated risks of childhood obesity, diabetes, leukemia and sudden infant death syndrome. For mothers, the lack of breastfeeding is associated with an increased incidence of breast cancer, ovarian cancer, weight gain and diabetes.

 
When is it Useful?
MIM for MOM is very useful:

During the first days after birth, spent in the hospital
During the first period of time, adjusting at home after the baby is born
When mothers need to closely monitor the amount of milk their baby is taking in
When getting ready to enroll the baby into a nursery
During the adjustment period of changing the baby’s standard diet – such as starting bottle feeding, or introducing solids or weaning from the breast

 
What are its Benefits?
MIM for MOM's benefits include:


Enhanced breastfeeding experience – MIM for MOM enhances the experience and quality of breastfeeding for mothers and babies, providing parents with answers to the question: “How much did our baby eat?”


Reduces worries and pain – The device helps to reduce both worries and pain of mothers by monitoring breastfeeding in an innovative way that is unlike any other on the market.

Tracking appetite and growth – The product allows tracking and recording the baby’s appetite and growth.

Assists in breastfeeding management – For instance, it builds a feeding table for single and/or multiple babies. It also indicates feeding/playing periods in a single breastfeeding. MIM for MOM allows managing breastfeeding in a smart way (e.g. more control, better balance, higher comfort and better smooth weaning).

Sharing information – MIM for MOM provides information that may be shared online with a spouse, family members or friends.

 
How Does MIM for MOM Work?
MIM for MOM is made up of (i) a necklace-based device and (ii) disposable components, which are the nipple dressings. These dressings are ultra-flat and narrow pads whose unique design enables lactation to be done in a natural manner since there is direct contact between a mom's breasts and her baby's lips and mouth. The mom takes a nipple addressing from a sterile pocket, wears it on her breast/s and breastfeeds the baby. As soon as the lactation ends, she throws the dressing to the trash.

Here’s more detail from one of our team members, Ms. Tali Gassner, who is a Certified Breastfeeding Counselor and a mother of two, on how MIM for MOM works:  
“It is basically an ultra thin strip of silicone-like material that is pressed on the breast covering part of the areola, but with a hole for the nipple. The display is attached to this strip by the necklace (that's the part that does the magic and manages to calculate the amount of milk the baby has gotten out of the breast). The great part is that we can actually show in real-time the amount of milk being nursed out of the breast, but the baby won't feel anything different than if the MIM for MOM weren't there! Only part of the areola is covered (and even that part is covered by an ultra thin layer) so the baby still feels and smells his mom. The nipple is not covered so the milk can flow freely. Each measuring strip comes in a sterile package and is for single use, to ensure the best level of accuracy and cleanliness for mom and baby. With the device we have currently built we reached a level of 97% in the measurement of milk. Once we have this funding, I believe the accuracy will be even higher since we can have the devices built more precisely.”
 
The technology behind this device was developed by Dr. Ofer Melamed, who has a PhD in brain science, is a chemist-physicist and a father of one, over the course of three years. Here's how he explains it:
“Milk is a very complex liquid. The milk density and viscosity vary from mother to mother, from breast to breast. As soon as the milk is ejected from the breast nipple, the temperature surrounding it drops. Measuring such a liquid requires overcoming on the limitations of a very sensitive environment, such as the mouth and nipple. We found a very sophisticated way to measure the flow by using fractional differential pressure gradients on a micro scale.”
 
Dr. Melamed also notes that: “I invented MIM for MOM after my wife and I had our first child and she nearly gave up on breastfeeding.”
 
How Can I Help? 
With your support, MIM for MOM will be productized much earlier and thus it will be available to mothers and babies much faster. We expect to be able to deliver by the end of 2013. Thank you in advance for all your help!

 
 
FAQ

A: Definitely. For the safety of the baby, MIM for MOM is made from FDA/CE approved materials. It is the same materials of the bottles and the dummy (pacifier).  
 
Q: Does MIM for MOM put a sensor in the baby’s mouth?
A: No.
 
Q: Does the baby touch the mother's breast?
A: Yes, the baby touches the mother's breast.
 
Q: Does the usage require additional work? 
A: No. MIM for MOM is designed in a way that accommodates a very busy mom. She may take a nipple dressing from a sterile pocket, wear it on her breast and breastfeed the baby. As soon as the lactation ends, she throws the dressing to the trash.
 
Q: What are MIM for MOM’s advantages for the short-run?
A: A mother is sure her baby had his or her meal. Mothers reach the optimal positioning for her and the baby. Mothers can plan gradual weaning. Mothers can be relaxed while the baby is eating.
 
Q: What are MIM for MOM’s advantages for the long-run?
A: You will have a track record of your baby’s development.
 
Q. Is MIM for MOM expensive?
A: No. MIM for MOM costs less than buying formula milk.
 
Q: Does MIM for MOM replace the lactation consultant?
A: No. MIM for MOM assists you and the lactation consultant to find the optimal position for your baby and give you immediate confidence.
 
Q: I don’t know if all my babies eat enough.
A: MIM for MOM will generate a full table for you with quantities and amounts.
 
Q: I have a painful breast. How does MIM for MOM help?
A: Pain occurs when wrong nursing management is performed. MIM for MOM may assist in managing your nursing time and quantities.

A: Definitely. A little amount of breastfeed milk incorporates quite large amount of nutrients. You may use MIM for MOM to quantify the amount of milk the baby ate by the breast and complete the meal with formula milk. In this way you keep your ability to produce milk.
 
Q: I am a working mother. How can MIM for MOM help?

A: The most important guideline for weaning is a gradual reduction. The gradual reduction will prevent the mother from pain and prevent shock for the baby. MIM for MOM can allow you track the time and the amount of breastfeeding.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sue and I am a Registerd Nurse in Wilmington, Delaware. I have been invited to participate in a charitable medical mission to Oyo State in Nigeria where we will provide free medical care for the people there and training to local medical personnel.

Why I Need Money and What It's For

Although all my expenses are paid by Premier Charities Inc (the 501c(3) organization sponsoring the trip) once I am in Nigeria, I am responsible for all expenses associated with getting there and back:

  • Round-trip airfare
  • Nigerian visa application
  • Mandatory vaccinations
  • Nigerian medical license

The Impact

This 2-week medical mission will provide free medical care in one of the poorest and most populous countries in the world. It will also help in training local doctors and nurses in modern western medical practices.

It Only Takes A Little

Donations of any amount will help. If I can get just 230 people to donate an average of just $10 each, I will have the money I need to take this trip and help  hundreds of people live healthier lives.

If I Don't Reach My Goal

If I am unable to collect the full amount required to go, and can't supplement the difference myself, I will donate any amount collected to Premier Charities for use in buying medical supplies to be donated to the Nigerian hospitals and clinics that will be hosting our group.

story:
The Story

I have always wanted to go serve in Tanzania, Africa and I have now been given this amazing opportunity through Help International. I will be going over there for a month this summer. The HELP model facilitates substantial developmental programs in third world countries that change the lives of not only the community members with whom we work, but also the lives of our volunteers, interns, and In-Country Directors. We work in programs that encompass project development, capacity building, cultural immersion, community education, entrepreneurship, and public health. But I can't get there without your help.

 

How You Can Help

Help me reach my goal of raising $1,500 by:

  • Donating $5, $10, $50, $100, or whatever you can! 100% of your donation will go towards the program costs.
  • Even if you can’t donate, spreading the word about this important work that HELP International does by sharing this link on Facebook, Twitter, or via email. Any action is better than none!
  • Following my blog (backseatdaisies.com) to receive updates on how your contribution is making a difference in Tanzania!

 

Your Impact

This Summer, from May 15 to June 15, I will be working to improve the lives of the people in Arusha, Tanzania and it’s surrounding areas. Alongside 10-15 volunteers and local community members, I will be working on sustainable developmental projects that include:

  • Building Wells - this way creating safe, clean, and accessible water
  • Working in the Orphanages ­– we will be serving in Your Sister’s Orphanage as well as the Osiligi Orphanage helping with development and curriculum.
  • Working in Health Clinics – serving in the Loliondo Health Clinic serving Masai tribal communities to improve health in the community.
  • Teaching and Implementing – training teachers in curriculum development and designing and implementing income-generating projects for them to keep using even after we’ve left.

 

Any small donation will help improve the lives of the people of Tanzania, who, everyday, live without the basic necessities of life that most people in the world take for granted. A good school, good health, and income-generating projects are just some of the things that HELP International aims to improve. Your donations will go directly towards sustainable developmental projects that Tanzanians will continue to use even after our brief month in-country.

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Danielle DeRuiter-Williams. I work for a state-wide non-profit advocacy organization focused on improving health policy at the local level. Outside of my "day job" I am pursuing a business degree at Mills College in Oakland where I will focus on microenterprise, entrepreneurship and improving health and wellness outcomes for underserved communities. 

The connection between physical, mental and spiritual health is undeniable and to me, yoga practice can be the key for many communities to unlock their potential. I want to help them do that. But first I have to have the proper qualifications to do so.

I first became passionate about the importance of health and wellness including fitness and yoga practice after a severe back injury with which I have been coping for the last 2+ years. I recognized how much chronic pain can impact a formerly highly productive individual's ability to complete even the most basic of tasks. At 25 years old I often found walking too painful to bear. All of that changed once I began taking yoga, Pilates and training with a personal trainer (after months of working with a physical therapist).

But the notion of pain, trauma and productivity scaled up to whole communities was a reality I could no longer ignore. 

I am hoping to fund a portion of fees for a 200-hour yoga teacher certification at Innerstellar Pilates and Yoga in Berkeley, CA. I attend this studio myself and find their instructors to be superbly qualified to assist with all kinds of student needs. I also recognize that these kinds of services and classes are often too expensive for most people or in other ways inaccessible. 

I want to take my soon-to-be-gained yoga instructor skills and utilize them with youth, community organizations, families, churches and other places and spaces where healing is needed.

You contribution has the opportunity to impact the lives of hundreds of individuals and families in the Oakland and Los Angeles, CA area and also back in my home state of Michigan where I intend to expand my business eventually. I intend to begin sharing my knowledge immediately. 

Your contribution can help me to heal trauma, pain and sickness negatively impacting some of our most vulnerable members of society. 

What I Need & What You Get

The total cost of the yoga certification course is $2995 (which is often cost prohibitive to those driven to teach for low or no fee as I am). I will come up with 2/3 of the fee, a total of $1995 and I am asking my community to support my pursuit of this expertise by contributing $1000. More information about the training can be found here.

What you get:

For contributing $5 you will receive a thank you note either via e-mail or snail mail.

For contributing $10 you will be subscribed to the monthly Find Your Fly e-newsletter FOREVER (unless you opt out of course). The newsletter will be filled with health, wellness, spirituality, fitness and lifestyle tips and tricks to help you "find your fly."

For contributing $25 you will receive a personalized fitness consultation to discuss ways that you can be healthier and more active.

For contributing $50 you will recieve the fitness consultation and a Find Your Fly T-shirt. 

For contributing $100 dollars you will recieve 2 hours of home organization (Oakland or LA area only) or 2 fitness training/private yoga sessions (Oakland or LA area only) or a styling or wardrobe consultation or 1 month of wellness coaching (can be done in person or virtually) including a personalized fitness plan AND a t-shirt.

For contributing $200+ you will receive 2 months of wellness coaching, a meal plan, 4 private yoga sessions (post-certification, in Oakland or LA area only), mention in the Find Your Fly Newsletter and a Find Your Fly t-shirt.

For contributing $500+ one month of private yoga sessions (Oakland or LA area for in-person or virtually via skype), a 3 month personalized wellness plan and a Find Your Fly t-shirt. 

If I do not reach my goal the funds I've collected will still go into savings and I will continue to save money until I can take the next teacher training (which won't be until 2014).

The Impact

In a world where there is so much pain and uncertainty it is important that we spend time cultivating inner peace and resiliency to be able to face these challenges. It is also important we gain tools that help us connect with others and see the value and purpose in one another.

Yoga is a great tool to foster that kind of deep understanding and engagement. Communities that are wrought with violence and despair often experience a sense hopelessness and a disconnect from one another. I want to try and bring some of this profound personal exploration and depth back to these communities so that they may begin to heal and find opportunity in what may seem like insurmountable odds. 

I am a pragmatist and know that the application of such real and proven techniques of improving integration of mind, body and spirit to underserved communities can have positive and long-lasting impacts on individuals, families and whole communities that have traditionally been excluded from such opportunities to grow and connect with one another. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, please take the time to share this campaign with your networks and others you think may be interested. You can also help by taking the time to connect with not only your love ones but also strangers or those facing hard times. Together we can build more harmonious and supportive circles and communities. 

Blessings to you.

story:
Yoga is a beautiful thing- connecting with people, sharing their love, finding their strength, and being comfortable in their vulnerability.  Teaching yoga is the greatest, most fulfilling gift to me; and being able to give back just as much brings the whole practice full-circle.  


I spent several years dancing, in both New York City and Seattle, chasing satisfaction and happiness, but never quite finding it.  It was not until I opened myself to yoga that I was able to capture those things and hold on to them. 

I've taught yoga at a small intentional community- Pleasant Valley Sanctuary- for four and a half months this summer.  The experience of working with some many people was so impacting in my life, that I know with certainty that teaching yoga is my path.   Having learned proper body alignment, and the essentials of anatomy and kinesiology, helped me hugely in my time leading yoga classes.  I find it amazing how much you can communicate to people, and the impact it can have on their lives- on the mat and off.

Yoga,  as well as meditation and breath work (or Pranayama), calms people, gives them confidence, and guides them to a deeper peace- one that, in my experience, is hard to find through other means in general. 

A certification in teaching Yoga will give me the chance to share this sweetness and beauty with others.  I have every intention of traveling extensively, in the US and internationally, teaching at other intentional communities and retreat centers---Spreading the love! 


So, here's what I'm asking of you:

My aim is to attend the 200 hour teacher training program at Mt. Madonna Center in California.  The program thoroughly covers all aspects of yoga- not merely the physical practice.  Whereas I already feel confident as a yoga teacher, I want to expand my knowledge and my fields of practices to become more complete as a teacher and practitioner.  I will be learning how to share meditation and pranayama as well as asanas (the physical postures).  I'm hoping to raise funds for just short of the cost of tuition as a commuting student.

I would so greatly appreciate this help!  

Thank you for taking the time.

story:
Short Summary

BACKGROUND
Dear Friend,

Do you know what it means to be in excruciating PAIN!

I do, I have seen it too many times. My name is Ajarat and I have been a nurse for over six years now. My first nursing job was at one of the nations leading Cancer Centers in Pennsylvania. It was a life changing experience for me where I learnt of the different kinds of cancers that exist and the very difficult Chemotherapy and Radiation treatment regimens that cancer patients have to go through. But one thing that stood out for a young nurse in training at that time was seeing what it meant to be in pain. Cancer can be very very PAINFUL!

Khadijah-Mobolaji is  a 35 year old mother of one who is currently at a hospital in India undergoing treatment for Tissue Sarcoma. The next line of treatment in her battle with this disease includes a surgical procedure to place an implant in her lumbar area to alleviate the excruciating pains she is feeling in her limbs. This is needed before another chemotherapy treatment regimen can take place. The costs for this is $16000 but I am hoping together, we can help raise at least $5000 towards it in the next 21 days.
Your Prayers and good wishes will also go a long way. Everyone can give something! If enough of us get behind it, we can help Khadijat get the much needed surgery to alleviate her pain and get on with beating this  Cancer!

If you need more pertinent information about Khadijat and her plan of care at the hospital, alternative ways to send in your donations or want to share your two cents on how we can reach this goal faster, please contact me by email at ajaratbada@gmail.com
I know we can do it. I am counting on you. Let's go!

I know we can do it. I am counting on you. Let's go!

story:
Update #3 Tuesday Sept. 17, 2014:

We just completed our amazing project in Bihar, India.  YOU CAN STILL DONATE to this highly effective project via our Indiegogo fundraising campaign, which will end on September 21, 2014.  If you’d like to donate beyond this date, please contact me directly.  Here is an overview of our last few days in Bihar:

After working 6 days straight and saying goodbye to Sahar, on Sunday I took a bit more time to rest and recover from a cold. The day was spent doing laundry, resting and observing and participating in other daily chores and activities with the survivors and staff. In the evening we all sat on the grass talking and playing the harmonium. Monday, I arose early to attend the 6:00am morning yoga class and was quite unexpectedly asked to teach it! It was a great opportunity to integrate some of the body focus stabilization skills we had worked with earlier in the group’s sessions. Then, I worked a long day giving individual sessions to many of the survivors helping them with the symptoms they struggle with most. Many of them experienced nightmares, extreme fears, and feeling sad often. One survivor reported feeling “stuck” when faced with stressful situations. It was good to have one-on-one time with them to explain about the effects of trauma and to teach them how to support regulating their bodies. I focused on helping them to stabilize and to feel a sense of internal power and containment, while also taking some time just to listen to them and to be with them, as some disclosed things they had never spoken to anyone about before. The day ended with a final meeting with the Amita, the coordinator and Deepshikka, the case-worker, as well as Mr. Dubey. This valuable time was spent on program development, which included reviewing and organizing all they had learned, and incorporating it into the overall treatment program. I also helped them to understand the importance of the phases of treatment and to develop realistic goals. We set goals for individuals and the group as a whole, particularly related to behavioral problems/anger, building ego strength/resources, and stabilization. Late that evening, I prepared for my departure from the Punarnawa Ashram Shelter and early the next day was escorted to the Bagdogra airport (3 hour drive) by Mr. Dubey, another field officer, and the driver.

Today, Sat. Sept. 20, 2014 -  I am writing from Lhamo’s Croissants in Dharamsala (thank you to Glyndie Nickerson, SEP, for this recommendation!). I would like to thank all of the donors who made this trip possible. Sahar and I, as well as the Punarnawa Ashram and Free the Slaves, are very grateful for your help. The ashram staff has been in dire need for more training and more help with the survivors. They told us they found our training to be very helpful. They greatly appreciated our warm and friendly style of relating and teaching and reported to us that they learned a lot about trauma and how to better support the survivors.

Your donations have made a tremendous difference in these people’s lives.  Thanks for your financial support that makes this all possible!

Regards, 

Beth Nielsen


Beth and Sahar with Ashram staff and our translators.

Amita, the ashram coordinator who works tirelessly long days, blows a conch shell at the end of her daily pooja at 7:00 am.


Update #2, Sunday, Sept. 14, 2014: The ashram shelter, which is set on lush green 5 acre parcel of land, has at its center a large open air gazebo (concrete floor with a tin roof) where we meet daily with the staff and residents and take all of our meals. Throughout this past week we have continued to hold trainings and small groups to discuss the traumatic effects and healing of sex trafficking. The staff had many questions related to specific survivors, as well as general questions around managing behavior and building relationships in the face of the extreme disregulation that comes with trauma. Some of the areas we helped them with included understanding the relationship between trauma and its influence on behavior and learning, how to help the children bring their bodies/nervous system’s back into balance, how to recognize and address their own secondary trauma, how to “shape” children’s behaviors, the importance of team work and clarification of their roles, the importance of empathic/reflective listening, when to refer for medication, how to respond when the child has nightmares or other more severe manifestations of trauma, and learning the stages of child development, as well the principles of play and art therapy. Though Sahar and I are both trauma experts and our styles are complimentary, there were also differences in our approaches which allowed us to offer the staff and children a wide variety of learnings and interventions for dealing with post traumatic stress. The trainings have flowed very nicely despite the fact that we just met!

On Sat. evening the survivors shared their love of dance with us. They danced to music videos on the tv, showed us their best moves and invited us to dance with them. They were quite entertained by our awkward attempts at Bollywood style dancing! Our fun time was topped off with a dramatic (for us at least) monsoon rain storm that drenched some of us on the way to the gazebo for dinner.

Today, Sahar said her goodbyes to the girls before she departed for the airport to catch her flight to Mumbai. She was escorted by Mr. Dubey, the ashram’s friendly accountant, who was one of the many staff who assisted us here.

In the last few days here, I will be continuing to teach and support the dedicated staff and survivors. I cannot post pictures of the girls because of their age and need for protection and confidentiality, but I can say, they are all very lovely, sweet and strong. The youngest is only five years old. They all seem to appreciate our help with their post traumatic stress and need it very much. Their bright smiles belie the deep suffering they harbor. Tomorrow I will offer individual sessions to the survivors who want them and will have one more meeting with staff to address any more questions they might have. Thank you for your support.

Warm regards, Beth


Update #1:  This past Monday, Sept. 8, Sahar and I made our way to the Punarnawa Ashram Shelter  in Purnea, Bihar. The Ashram is set in a remote area to keep the girls as safe as possible, and the barbed wire on the walls as well as the guards at the gates also ensure this safety. On our drive to the Ashram, we drove through flood damaged roads surrounded by beautiful lush green fields and rice patties of the village outside the compound. We were graciously welcomed by the staff and spent the first day getting to know them, having them get used to us, and setting the agenda for the week’s training. They then gave us a tour of their facility which included the classrooms for vocational training and education, and the organic farming and animal husbandry areas, equipped with solar panels and a bio diesel system. We then spent a few hours discussing the residents and the challenges they face. We were informed that at least 4-6 of the current residents were rescued from the local red light district in Purnea that was pointed out to us. Others come from neighboring districts and other parts of India and Nepal, such as Bangladesh and Uttar Pradesh. We ended the day with an uplifting and hopeful story about 3 sisters that had been trafficked separately, who through the anti-trafficking system had been rescued and reunited at the Ashram. They are now awaiting the arrival of their 4th sister who was trafficked to Nepal where she has been rescued. Upon her arrival they will be all be reintegrated together and able to start a new life. In the days that followed, we led an all staff training and two group trainings. There we introduced important concepts and exercises in working with the mind body connection in survivors of trauma. We are looking forward to continuing to support staff in integrating theses learning’s as well as providing group and individual sessions with the residents as they warm to our presence. Thank you for your support and the generous contributions that made this all possible. We will continue to update as much as possible given the remote setting and the internet scarcity that comes with this! 

Regards, Beth and Sahar

The Project

The child survivors of sex trafficking at Punarnawa’s  Shelter in Bihar, India are suffering from its devastating traumatic effects. Please help fund the development of a trauma program and training with psychotherapists and trauma experts, Dr. Sahar Bhaloo and Beth Nielsen, M.A. by donating to Lotus Circle International. Our goal is to raise $10,000 in order to launch this project, which will begin September 2014.

 

INTRODUCTION

Free The Slaves (FTS) (www.freetheslaves.net) has invited myself, Beth Nielsen (California, USA), Lotus Circle International founder and trauma therapist, and Dr. Sahar Bhaloo (Mumbai, India), psychologist and global mental health consultant, to offer staff and residents of the shelter cutting edge clinical training, consultation and treatment in somatically-based psychotherapeutic work that will facilitate trauma healing and empowerment.

Residents are experiencing severe symptoms of post-traumatic stress and are in need of skilled psychotherapy support for trauma recovery. The highly dedicated staff of this clinic includes one mental health caseworker with limited clinical training and others who provide practical and logistical support to the caseworker.  FTS and the staff themselves have recognized the critical need to recruit a qualified mental health counselor for the recovery home, but no one has been willing to come to live in this remote area.

This project is aimed at providing in-depth training to the case worker as well as other shelter staff, in trauma-healing skills which will help the girls suffering with symptoms of post traumatic stress (PTSD), as well as the staff experiencing vicarious traumatization.

DETAILS ABOUT THIS PROJECT

We will be sharing our expertise by offering two weeks of training, consultation, program development, and treatment to staff and the women and girls. Trainings will focus on trauma healing and empowerment with a psycho-biologically based therapy known as Somatic Experiencing, as well as other trauma focused methods.

Background

Sex traffickers target young people who are desperate for a better life, as well as families that find it hard to feed their children. In 2004, Free the Slaves began a major program to eradicate trafficking from Bihar, India, where the population of over 83 million, are among the poorest in the world. 

Photo © by Carol Metzker 

The field staff soon confronted the traumatic effects of trafficking on the lives of girls and young women and the lack of capacity to address their needs. In 2010 they helped to open the Punarnawa shelter for trafficking survivors near Purnea. The shelter serves over 25 women and girls, all of who suffer from the persistent and devastating effects of trauma from sex trafficking. The women and girls frequently experience post-traumatic symptoms such as flashbacks, nightmares and hypervigilance in addition to emotional and physical symptoms including muscle pain/tension, stomach pain and other gastrointestinal problems, headaches, and other ailments unexplained by medical causes.

The shelter offers residents, who stay for approximately 12 months, a comprehensive program that includes shelter, legal assistance, medical care, emotional and psychological recovery, education vocational skills training and help in accessing economic entitlements. Women are also encouraged and supported to participate in advocacy on behalf of themselves and other trafficking survivors.

The shelter focuses strongly on the promotion of economic independence, an understanding of human and civil rights, and an atmosphere of shared work and equality.

Residents are continuing to suffer without the treatment they desperately need, and for some, the PTSD is becoming chronic and debilitating, preventing them from re-establishing a productive life.

Please help these women and girls take full advantage of the opportunity to recover by helping us provide them with the treatment they need.

Photo © by Carol Metzker 

Consultants

Dr. Sahar Bhaloo, is a Clinical Psychologist specializing in Global Mental Health in traumatized and underserved populations; immigrants, refugees, asylees, trafficking victims and survivors of torture and gender-based violence. She has served as a consultant in post war Sri Lanka with internally displaced survivors of the civil war and in India with tele-mental health in rural populations. Dr. Bhaloo has also collaborated on the creation of a manualized training for local clinicians treating post war trauma in Rwanda and on a paraprofessional community health worker training manual for work with mental health medical clinic establishment and development initiative for the treatment of gender-based violence crimes in Uvira, Democratic Republic of Congo. She also has a research background in the study of immigrant Acculturation, Acculturative Stress and Stigma. Dr. Bhaloo spent the first 18 years of her life in Cote D’Ivoire West Africa before moving to Canada and then the US to complete her graduate and post-graduate degrees in clinical psychology. Dr. Bhaloo currently lives in India working on gender based violence and stigma reduction. This child trafficking work with Free The Slaves is an especially a crucial area of work in creating a hopeful future for young women in India exposed to gender-based violence.

Beth Nielsen is a Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist, Somatic Experiencing Practitioner, and founder of Lotus Circle International (LCI), a U.S. based nonprofit whose mission is to assist underserved populations affected by violence, disasters, and adversity by providing somatically based (mind-body) training and treatment for trauma resolution.  Beth maintains a private practice in San Francisco, CA and has been a Senior Assistant and Consultant with the Somatic Experiencing Trauma Institute  (www.traumahealing.com)  for 13 years. She has helped train hundreds of therapists in Somatic Experiencing, a psycho-physiologically based method of healing trauma. Her passion for this work lead her into the field of Global Mental Health and in 2005, she helped organize a four-year post Tsunami trauma recovery project in Tamil Nadu with Sr. Somatic Experiencing faculty and Trauma Vidya founder, Raja Selvam (www.TraumaVidya.org). In 2009 she founded LCI, and initiated a Women’s Empowerment Project in collaboration with Auroville Village Action Group (Tamil Nadu, India) aiding NGO staff and local village women affected by gender-based violence. In 2013 she assisted in another Trauma Vidya project in collaboration with Don Bosco, offering an Integral Trauma Resolution Training in Sri Lanka for counselors and other NGO staff with post war trauma.

She has also consulted on or participated in other trauma training and recovery projects in Kigali, Rwanda, and in Beijing, China.

To learn more about Beth and her work you may visit her website at www.lotuscircleinternational.org To reach her directly you may phone her at (415) 359-5597 or email her at Bethlotus@gmail.com

Our Approach

The development of a trauma sensitive recovery program at the shelter will start with two weeks of training in a cutting edge psycho-physiological (mind-body) method of healing post traumatic stress, and training for all staff in basic counseling skills, case management skills, documentation training, as well as training for incorporating trauma healing principles in all daily activities. We also plan to provide ongoing consultation for continued program development and clinical support. Both staff and residents will be taught to utilize these skills to stabilize themselves when they feel emotional and physical distress. This is a holistic approach that empowers people from the inside out.

HOW FUNDS WILL BE USED

Monies raised will be used to cover basic expenses for arranging trauma specific training by expert consultants (including airfare, basic lodging upon arrival, ground transportation, and food). Additional monies raised will go to support general operating expenses for Lotus Circle International, as well as future trainings and consultations for the Punarnawa Shelter or other LCI projects for underserved populations worldwide.

You can also help us by spreading the word about this project and using the Indiegogo sharing tools! Please help us bring these girls and staff the vital resources and support they need so they can return to their homes and lead productive and healthy lives!

In peace,
Beth Nielsen, MFT
Dr. Saher Bhaloo

Photo © by Carol Metzker 


This project is supported by Project Peace in Berkeley. Project Peace creates partnerships between local churches and social service providers that work together for just and sustainable communities in Berkeley, Oakland, and surrounding areas.  http://projectpeaceeastbay.org

has also consulted on or participated in other trauma training and recovery
projects in Kigali, Rwanda, and in Beijing, China.
To learn more about Beth and her work you
may visit her website at www.lotuscircleinternational.org To reach her directly you may phone her at (415)
359-5597 or email her at Bethlotus@gmail.com
Our Approach
The development of a trauma
sensitive recovery program at the shelter will start with two weeks of training
in a cutting edge psycho-physiological (mind-body)
method of healing post traumatic stress, and training for all staff in basic
counseling skills, case management skills, documentation training, as well as
training for incorporating trauma healing principles in all daily activities.
We also plan to provide ongoing consultation for continued program development
and clinical support. Both staff and residents will be
taught to utilize these skills to stabilize themselves when they feel emotional
and physical distress. This is a holistic approach that empowers people from
the inside out. 
HOW
FUNDS WILL BE USED
Monies raised will be used to cover
basic expenses for arranging trauma specific training by expert consultants (including
airfare, basic lodging upon arrival, ground transportation, and food).
Additional monies raised will go to support general operating expenses for Lotus
Circle International, as well as future trainings and consultations for the
Punarnawa Shelter or other LCI projects for underserved populations worldwide. 
You can also help us by spreading the word about this project and using the Indiegogo sharing tools! Please help us bring these girls and staff the vital resources and support they need so they can return to their homes and lead productive and healthy lives!
In peace,
Beth Nielsen, MFT
Dr. Saher Bhaloo


Photo © by Carol Metzker 




This project is supported by Project Peace in Berkeley. Project Peace creates partnerships between local churches and social service providers that work together for just and sustainable communities in Berkeley, Oakland, and surrounding areas.  http://projectpeaceeastbay.org

story:
Update-

Hello Everyone,
Thank you so very much for taking the time to look at this Campaign. This Campaign is to help raise money to help with all the expenses that unfortunately go along with the horrible horrible disease Cancer! My Mom was diagnosed in December 2012, we did have a Campaign shortly after we found out she was diagnosed and we do want to thank everyone who donated! It has now been a Year and a Half and bills, gas money to downtown Detroit, Medication, and needed expenses all add up very very fast, not to mention we ended up having to get a new vehicle (a "new" used vehicle lol) so we could get my Mom to and from Khemo reliably, so we really need to reach out to everyone and try and raise Donations to help her to continue her treatments, etc. It is really hard for us financially because not only does my my Mom has Stage 3 Cancer, My Dad and I are also both disabled. When my Mom was first diagnosed she was told she had Stomach Cancer, after Months (and a new Doctor) we have now found out she has Stage 3 Ovarian Cancer. She has been going through lots of Khemo and Treatments, and has had surgery to try and get rid of this horrible thing, but unfortunately her numbers are going back up and she is now receiving Aggressive Khemo to try and nip this thing in the butt! I have left My Mom and our Families Story below so anyone who has not read it can still have the chance to read it and see how much of a wonderful Woman my Mom is and how Dear she is to my Father and I's Heart and also everyone around her! Thank you again for looking and reading, and if you can afford to make a small donation it would mean A LOT, and if you can't afford a donation, please donate 30 seconds of your time and share this link anywhere you can! It can be accessed from www.4Lynnette.com


Original Story-

The next few minutes are for anyone who cares enough to take the next few minutes of their life to read about a women who deserves every minute you give her! My name is Richard, son of Lynnette and Johnny. I really have no idea where to begin, my parents are quite literally my best friends and I would not change it for a thing. In this Campaign I went further then just "asking for donations", I want this Campaign to tell my Moms story!

Let start in 1983 when my Mom Lynnette just found out she was pregnant. This is a time when most women are so very much happy and excited, and I am sure my Mom had felt the same way, but behind all that excitement still laid a feeling that NO women wants to feel. To explain what I mean, I need to take you back even further, when my Mom was 9 years old she was diagnosed with Kidney Disease. She spent her whole childhood in & out of hospitals, surgery's and transplants. By the age of 13 she has went through more then most people need to go through in a life time 10 times over, and over the years she has had TWO transplants, the years following I am sure she was excited that the 2nd transplant was doing well, but the disease also left her with a lifetime of other problems like very low immune system, life long medications, other complications including NOT having children. So when my Mom found out she was pregnant with me....a time when a woman is suppose to be on top of the world, the doctors are telling her she CANNOT have me, but against ALL the doctors NO's my Mom stood tall and told them all that she did not care the risks to herself, if the baby would be healthy is all she cared about, so putting ALL her problems and health aside for me, she went on with the pregnancy. Sure there were some complications, and some problems here and there but she said strong through the whole process and never once put herself before me, she quite literally was 100% willing to give her own life, to give life to her baby son....ME, and I will never ever forget that.

Through the years our Family has had many many downs, but I would trade nothing for all the great UP's that we had as well! Though my Mom had a hard childhood that led to a rough adulthood, she always gave her heart to the people around her. When I was 5 years old my Father was in a very bad accident that left him with a broken back and broken neck that led to MANY MANY surgeries, and even though my Mom had so many things to worry about with herself she still stood by his side through every single one of those surgeries giving her support, help and love to him and I, taking care of ANYTHING that needed to be done, paying bills, working 2 jobs to pay bills, driving to hospitals, running the house! She did ANYTHING the family needed, because she cared! My Father and I can not thank her enough, nor would a thanks be close to enough. My Father still of course has many problems and is still to this day having surgeries to help with the problems, and even now 20 years later my Mom STILL does everything she can for him and I.

In 2005 another tragedy struck when I was in a very severe high speed motorcycle accident that left me hospitalized for a month, and after discharged I needed home care for the next year. The hospital recommended a temp home, or a full time nurse to help, but my Mom INSISTED that she help her baby boy, she spent the next year of her life changing bandages and taking care of me in ANYWAY that she could, because that is just the type of wonderful person she is. How do you thank someone for something like that? And again same as my Father, to this day...even 8 years later I still have chronic pain and problems, and again still to this day my Mom gives her heart to make sure she does everything she can to make my life just that much better. And I truly cannot ever thank her enough for everything she has done and continues TO do for me. A few years after my accident, my Mom was in a accident as well that ended up totaling her pick-up truck and left her with chronic back pain and has also had a knee replacement, but even with those problems piled on to everything else....she STILL stands strong and gives 100% to the Family.

Then in 2006 my Grandma became ill, and my Mom being the wonderful person she was, stopped working and basically moved in with my Grandma (Her Mother). She lived with my Grandmother for about 80% of the time for the next 2 years, and helped my Grandmother is any and every way she could, driving her, cleaning her, cleaning her house, laundry, pay bills and everything else needed to make my Grandmas life just that much easier for her, ALL on top of still taking care of my Father and I all at the same time, I truly do not know how she did it, I think she is secretly superwoman, and if shes not....then she is 100% still Superwoman in my eyes that is for sure. Unfortunately my Grandmother passed away, and that was very hard on my Mom, and still is, but again my Mom stands strong giving 100% to us, and again....how on earth does someone show how much that means to them? It means the world to me, and I hope she realizes that.

You normally would think that....come on, this Family has been through enough, they lived happily ever after.....right? Unfortunately, this is not the way the cards fell. December 19th, 2012, my Mom was diagnosed with Stomach Cancer (Update: her new amazing Doctor, Dr. Seward, found that it was actually Ovarian Cancer and performed her surgery too), its is very hard to come to terms with this because although NO person deserves that horrible disease, but I think she truly deserves to NOT have been burdened with this, she has been through to much to deal her such cards. She will be spending time going through surgeries and tests, chemo, etc. & she is tough enough that I know she will beat it, but I also wanted to come here to let the world know the wonderful person she is, and hope she will be in everyone's prayers and thoughts. Unfortunately my Mom has NO insurance (Update: my Mom has recently been put on Medicaid), and I need to reach out more then ever for a helping hand from ANYONE who has a hand to give. Family, Friends, and Strangers alike, I think my Mom Lynnette DESERVES more then anyone to NOT have to have this burden on her shoulders and I would like for this Campaign to get as Viral as possible to not only tell her story and show my everlasting love. But I also truly believe that my Mom 100% DESERVES a break, I would not only like this campaign to generate enough money to help pay doctors, hospitals, prescriptions and treatments, BUT I also would love for it to generate enough money for her to just get away for awhile.......relax.....really truly take a break, she has been working NON STOP since 9 years old....Don t you think she FINALLY deserves a vacation?

Please help in anyway you can! If all you can do is pass this campaign on to someone else, then PLEASE do. If you can afford to donate then by all means, PLEASE do. Lynnette really deserves SO much more, but if telling her story and reaching a helping hand makes a big enough difference to lift just SOME of that burden, then at least I feel like I have just STARTED the process of repaying my Mom for all the Love, Blood, Sweat, Tears and more Love that my Mom has given me my entire life! I want her Positive, Standing Strong and Determined, the last thing I want on her mind is how bills are going to be paid, she has other things to focus on right now! Thank you for taking the time to read this, and again please help in anyway possible, if you know her at all you KNOW she more then deserves the help and if you do not know her, I hope you feel like you do know her enough now to know that she deserves all the help that is given.

I have Faith my Mom will handle this like she has handled all the other hurdles in her life, and beat it! But every prayer helps!

Again Thank you.

Richard, LOVING Son of my WONDERFUL Mom Lynnette & Dad Johnny!

story:
Short Summary

Our Board of Directors recently received tragic news from our representative in Malawi, Hon. Dr. Clement T. Chiwaya, MP:

"I received a call from the headmaster of Samama school . . . . They told me that a kid has been attacked by a crocodile and although rescued by villagers, doctors had to amputate his leg.  The head teacher is worried that his pupils fetch water there and when school opens . . . his pupils will be at risk because many fetch water there."

We were able to immediately send funds for the construction of a well at Samama School. At that time, we also made a commitment to drill water wells at seven other schools in the area. This page is to help us finance one of these schools: the Mkumbi School.

To date, our organization has built a total of 260 water wells in Malawi. We have an impressive system in place to install water wells for approximately $1200 each.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1200 in order to fund this project. Anything you can find in your heart to give towards this goal is greatly appreciated!

We offer in return for your donation:

  • The assurance that every dollar we receive goes 100% to our cause. We take care of all administrative expenses ourselves.
  • Knowing exactly how the money is being used – including, if you wish, the opportunity to travel with us to see first hand all of the good your donation is generating.

Please note that Indiegogo and FirstGiving will subtract modest fees for their services--3% and 4% of all donations, respectively, provided that we reach our goal. (For more details, click here.) As stated above, however, all money we receive goes directly to our cause.

The Impact

Just a simple, hand-operated water well can be beneficial in so many ways!

  • Improve health -- Water wells obviate the need for using contaminated water sources. According to Hon. Dr. Clement Chiwaya, a member of Parliament and our representative in Malawi, the Warm Hearts Foundation's efforts "have managed to reduce the number of waterborne diseases" in Mangochi.
  • Facilitate education -- Children can devote time to school rather than walking miles to draw water.
  • Prevent bodily harm -- This past summer, a child was attacked by a crocodile at the water source and doctors had to amputate his leg.

Other Ways You Can Help

We still want your help even if you aren't in a position to give! You can:

  • Get the word out! Use Indiegogo share tools, spread our message on Facebook, etc. Crowd funding works best on social media!
  • We are always looking for volunteers. Feel free to shoot us an email at warmheartsfoundation@gmail.com.

For more information, visit our website! Also, be sure to like our Facebook page!

story:
My mother, Carol Acord, has been diagnosed with several rather serious medical problems in her lungs: Micobacterium Avium Complex, Bronchiecstasis, and possible Tuberculosis.

Any one of these sicknesses would be very problematic alone, so you can imagine how bad it is to be diagnosed with all three.

The only facility that can treat her is about 1,500 miles away in Colorado. The treatments are long, arduous, and often worse than the sickness itself.

My parents are not able to meet the expenses involved in all these medical bills and travel expenses. Any little bit helps, of course, but the more we can raise, the better

Mom has always been there for me. I would love to use this as a chance to give back a little.

 

Thanks,

Micah Acord

story:
Hari passed away this morning, Sunday, July 29th 2012. It is unthinkable that such a tragedy can befall such a wonderful person and family.

--------------------------------

My brother-in-law's sister Gemily and her boyfriend Harison were struck by a car going 80 MPH in a residential area while walking their 4 dogs.

The dogs were killed instantly and Harrison's leg was severed while trying to protect Gemily who was still severely injured. Gemily has recently been released from the hospital but will face months of physical therapy. Harison is still in critical but stable condition and will likely face several more surgeries.

News Stories:

http://www.sacbee.com/2012/07/26/4661527/he-came-so-fast-and-hit-us-so.html

http://fairoakscarmichael.news10.net/news/crime/101886-carmichael-hit-and-run-pedestrians-idd-car-described

http://www.sacbee.com/2012/07/18/4638401/2-badly-injured-4-dogs-killed.html

http://www.sacbee.com/2012/07/20/4643683/suspect-arrested-in-carmichael.html

 

The hit and run suspect has been apprehended, but he does not have any insurance, was driving intoxicated with a suspended license. Gemily and Harison will be on their own to deal with the expenses related to hospitalization and recovery as well as ongoing costs for prosthetics and lifestyle changes.

Contributions will be added to those already generously donated to the Harison Long-Randall and Gemily West fund to help them with their mounting medical bills and their life-long struggle to overcome this tragedy.

You can either contribute here or by mail to:

Harison Long-Randall and Gemily West fund
ATTN: Pam Dinsmore
Community Affairs Director
The Sacramento Bee
2100 Q St.
Sacramento, CA 95816

Thank you so much, every little bit helps.

story:
If you have landed here why not help Activation Life take our final step in our product introduction?  If you can support us with as little as $15 or something more…………it will make a difference!  We need you!!!


Don’t want another device……………..that’s ok.  We’ll ship you a microSD card that you can insert into your mobile phone so you can use Activation Life treatments on your own device.  See the awards on the right side of the page to see how you can get one shipped to you.

With a comprehensive understanding of human neurology, and backed by in-clinic research, Dr. Steven Moe and Musician Paul Peterson have developed a series of “Sonic Therapies” that have been shown to stimulate specific neural pathways in the brain and body.  When stimulated, these pathways increase balance, strengthen extensor muscles (which increases joint stability and therefore reduces injuries), and increase fine motor control. Because the muscles are stimulated to fire at a higher rate, athletes experience increased strength and speed, and improved agility and coordination. For example, golfers consistently hit the ball farther and straighter after using Sonic Therapy. In addition to athletic performance enhancement, early studies have also shown that Dr. Moe’s sonic therapy can improve balance in the elderly and thus reduce the number of incidents in which old folks fall and break their hips, and often die. This could make a huge contribution to the well-being of our aging population.

These benefits have made Dr. Moe’s Accelerated Performance Clinic a training and rehab destination for countless professional and elite amateur athletes. Luminaries such as MLB All Star Jim Thome and World Class Marathon Winner Dick Beardsley use this technology to attain peak performance beyond what regular training can achieve.

Activation Life’s Sonic Therapy has helped to produce physical breakthroughs and personal best athletic performances for countless individuals. Now we’re excited to share this technology with you. People of any age or physical condition can now experience improvements in the following areas:

·         Overall Balance

·         Muscle Tone

·         Muscle Strength

·         Agility

·         Core stability

·         Fine Motor Control

·         Oxygenation

·         Aerobic performance

·         Reaction time

·         Speed of Recovery

 

For the past 5 years Doc and Paul have been developing and refining their process to take in-clinic treatments using these very specific vibrational frequencies, integrate them into custom composed music, and burn them to a dedicated portable device that athletes and patients can use outside of the clinic.  Our soon to be released Dedicated Digital Delivery Device puts the power of Sonic Therapy literally “in your hands”, allowing you to experience the benefits of Activation Life’s treatment protocols wherever you happen to be!

Please help us make this life altering technology available to all.  To see pictures of the device click on the Gallery tab.


Improving the Runner -

 

 

Endorsed and used regularly by world class long-distance runner Dick Beardsley who has worked with Dr. Moe's Sonic Therapy in-clinic for years;   Activation Life's Running Series has been shown to increase muscle extension, delivering a calming effect to the nervous system, which increases the size of the blood vessels allowing for hight oxygen levels in the bloodstream leading to a faster recovery and improved performance.

Improving the Golfer -

The Activation Life Golf Series has been shown to improve balance, stability and fine motor control; all of which are critical elements to realize consistent and improved performance to the golfers swing.

Improving Seniors -

Activation Life's Balance Series has been shown to promote balance, muscle strength and stability.  Exciting areas of the brain that becomes deficient with age "recharges" neural connections and can reduce the risk of falling, leading to fewer injuries that result from poor balance.

Improving the Athlete -

Activation Life's Training Series was specifically designed for individuals who exercise regularly whether running, biking, or performing any other form of cardio or weight training.  This series has been shown to increase muscle extension, create a calming effect to the nervous system which increases the size of the blood vessels allowing for higher oxygen levels in the bloodstream.  This ultimately leads to improved digestion and reducing the likelihood of injury.

story:
Our Story

Hello, my name is Shola McCarthy. You know as I was growing up I was hoping one day I would have a son of my own. My father had 6 boys and we all had girls. We was starting to believe we was cursed. Then my 1st born son Chinedu was born which means God leads. Then 2 years later I was blessed again with another son his name is Tobechi. Which means praising God. This son was different. He spend his 1st week of life in ICU and he was a full term baby. The doctor gave us the news. Our son was born with a genetic disorder called Trisomy 21. I was completely destroyed by this news and confused. Why is God punishing me through my son? I had to takw time to think and realized what a blessing he is.


The Impact

The 1st question I had to ask is What is Trisomy 21? Trisomy Is a genetic disorder in your chromosomes. Every man and woman is born with 46 chromosomes. 23 chromsomes from each parent. So from 1 to 23 you should have 2 one from mom and one from dad. Now on the 21st chromsome my son Tobechi have 3 giving him 47 instead of 46. This disorder is commonly known as downs syndrome. Over 400,000 people are effected by it. It's hard for scientist to tell which parent spawn off the extra chromsome. All they could tell us was that he's was random that his mother was highly unlikely to have another child with trisomy 21 if she decided to have another. So many doctors appointments, lost of income, and the uncertainty off his future and children like him affects me deeply.


What We Need & What

We are trying to raise $15,000,000 to build and finance a facility.$250,000 from this site. This facility would provide OT, PT, Speech Therapy, and educational developmental skills training. So many people are in that grey area with INS. You make too much for medicaid, ins don't cover much or to expensive, or worse U just got a job, but they won't pick your child up because of the preexisting condition. This Facility would allow all to have proper care.This facility would also have an outreach program and financial planning. Whatever is given will be used for a greater purpose. Our 1st goal is to reach 40,000. Those who gave $10 or more will be given and opportunity to win a $gift cards, an ipad2, a 60inch LG flat screen T.V, and a 2009 Nissan Murano Still looking like new. Our gift to you for your love and support.

Other Ways You Can Help

Well maybe you can't afford to give but you know someone who could. Please pass this link around to your friend and neighbors and social newtworking sites such as Facebook and tweeter. We are always just 1 donor away from reaching our goal. So please spread the word.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Darius Lewis and I'm 12 years old and I would like to become a professional soccer player one day in the not too distant future. I started competitive soccer at the age of 7 and have been the leading goal scorer on my team over the past 5 years. I have recently been selected to represent Florida Region III through the ODP program this summer in Alabama and have been invited to participate at the West Ham International Academy in Georgia also this summer. One of my major highlights of my short soccer career is when I got an invitation from the US Soccer Federation to participate at their US Training Centers which is geared to replicate National Team Training. I am currently in 6th Grade at West Gate K8 and have managed to maintain a 4.0 GPA during the past school year. I have recently been identified and invited to join the European Soccer Club in Miami which is coached by Master Carlos Cantarero who is a former coach at Atleco Madrid in Spain.

I truly will appreciate all the help I can get from all my family, friends and those now getting to know me in trying to reach my financial goal so that I can make my soccer dream a reality and it all begins this summer. I sincerely thank you all in advance and I'll continue my hard work and dedication both on and off the field of play and promise to make each and everyone of you proud of me both as a player and a person.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $3000 which goes to the following:

European Soccer Club 2012/13 season - $1650

West Ham International Academy - $525

Travelling & Hotels - $825

Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to forward my link to any of your friends and family and I will also welcome any new soccer gears for my upcoming socccer season.

story:
Who is EEM Collection and what the heck is its purpose?

A former MAC addict turned natural beauty expert, eco-preneur, and green girl newbie, Mindy Perez is a refreshingly down-to-earth mom of 3 who oozes with creativity and radiates enthusiasm when she speaks of her "organically couture cosmetics" boutique and EEM Collection  products.
 
Having lost both her parents to cancer, she has devoted her life to doing everything in her power to educate her family of 5 and all others about toxins and carcinogens we all involuntarily (and voluntarily) expose ourselves to on a daily basis and how to best avoid them - beginning with what's lurking in your bathroom cabinets and on your vanity.
 
For years, Mindy has sought organic shampoos, conditioners, lotions, etc. that ACTUALLY work in order to slowly make the necessary changes to avoid absorbing the chemicals hiding in heavily marketed, popular cosmetics. She found many but, still, the organic and natural cosmetics available in the marketplace lacked a certain pizzazz that a now reformed MAC addict (who is far from a hippie) longed for. That is the very reason EEM Collection was born -to be both green and glam! Being able to create looks from au natural to couture with a complete variety of safe, high quality products is needed to help turn the girliest of girls and makeup divas to organic & natural cosmetics as well!
 
That being said, Mindy sincerely believes that cosmetics should provide care for your outside not fill a void on the inside. Makeup should be used to enhance your natural beauty, used as an art form, and used just for FUN! Go bare with potent skincare or go glam with pigments and bronzers for heavy contouring. It is for these reasons EEM Collection's Mineral Cosmetics were created!  LOVE yourself and take care of what you have been blessed with - YOU ARE BEAUTIFUL!

Where your generous funds will go:

  • All contributions will be used to further develop the EEM cosmetic line, professionally bulk screen print on containers (rather than labels), implement the EEM skin care line, heavy marketing to get the brand name recognized, hire a professional photographer and models, and generate/revamp the EEM website.
  • Everyone knows the organic/natural makeup and skincare market is highly competitive but who wants boring and dull or overpriced items?!  I want to go head to head with MAC's line and be bold and daring but NON-TOXIC. 

EEM's Impact

EEM will very soon be working closely with a non-profit organization that will visit cancer patients in need.  We are passionate about our purpose to spread the word on how chemicals in cosmetics can negatively impact our systems.  We strive to begin:

  • Educating patients (and young people in general) on the importance of reading personal care product labels and haing the knowledge to decifer the good from the horribly ugly ingredients
  • Helping people make the right natural/organic choices to limit their exposure to unnecessary toxins
  • Assist cancer patients with choosing the right wigs for them after they lose their hair from chemo/radiation
  • Teaching cancer patients how to apply non-toxic makeup to their brow area to  build confidence
  • Helping them choose the right skincare for them and will be putting together complimentary care baskets to soothe their aching feet, dry skin patches and overall changes they may be experiencing due to cancer treatment

 

My admiration of nature's treasures:

Quite intrigued by the remarkable healing and all around beneficial properties of nature's blessings and elegant splendor of beautifying plants, fruits, and vegetables, I took my creativity to the next level when I honed my skills of mixing body creams and mineral makeup with my understanding of superior skin nourishing ingredients to create beauty potion "works of art" with my EEM Collection line.

As my knowledge of ingredients grew, so did my demand for higher quality products. My passion will always be far from just creating "safer and purer natural products" but instead to formulate truly beneficial, powerful skincare and cosmetics that will heal, nuture, and beautify the skin.

EEM Collection formulas are natural and as organic as possible and always free of petrochemicals, all known carcinogens, parabens, sulfates, phlataltes, mineral oil, and genetically modified ingredients. Our ingredients and formulas are never tested on animals. We make our products with the highest quality ingredients using only natural plant oils, bases, and essences that are certified organic, wildcrafted, and/or all natural. All ingredients are obtained from farmers and suppliers who uphold sustainable practices and carefully steward the land and obtained from sources that practice fair trade, ensuring that those who provide them are treated with the upmost dignity and compensated fairly.

EEM Collection products are contained in recycled, recyclable, or reusable packaging, using minimal amounts.

 

No $ - No biggie ~ You can still help!

So you just can’t contribute - believe me, I get it, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help out:

  • Let your friends and family know about our campaign and our purpose to educate and have fun with natural products.
  • Share, share away with Indiegogo's share tools!
