story:
We are Villanova Quidditch!

 

Your money will help us pay for 21 players flights, hotels for 21 players, rental vans for transportation, food, and water. Thank you in advance! :D

 

Formed in the Fall of 2009, Villanova Quidditch has come a long way from our humble beginnings as a group of 12 players riding up in a big white van to Middlebury, Vermont for World Cup III. We've worked with an increasingly large group of players to develop one of the best programs in the nation!

 

Our team works hard to ride the line between the competitive aspect of quidditch while still keeping it fun. One day you'll find us out on Sheehan Beach crushing a group of Sig Chi pledges who thought it'd be funny to play us, and the next we'll be at a birthday party down the street teaching kids how to play the sport.

 

This year, Villanova Quidditch has taken our competitive aspect to the next level. We won every tournament we entered this fall, including outlasting the entire Mid-Atlantic Region in November to be crowned the first United States Regional Champions in the history of Quidditch!

 

We REALLY need your help! We have a group of 21 kids who have been looking forward to going to Orlando since the day we qualified in early November. We won't be able to go without the support of the entire Villanova and Quidditch communities.

 

Any amount you can donate will help! To help you get to know the team more, here is some info:

We'd love for you to get to know us, so check out www,novaquidditch.tumblr.com!

 

 

***Disclaimer: Villanova Quidditch is a sanctioned group of Villanova University. However, this page is not sanctioned by Villanova University, therefore the university assumes no responsibility or liability of this page. All comments, questions and concerns should be directed toward Dan Takaki or Zach D'Amico. Comments may be left on the page and will be responded to promptly

Players:

Dan Takaki, #21, Seeker, Captain: Chicago, Illinois (Sophomore)

Zach D'Amico, #10, Chaser, Captain: Boston, Massachusetts (Senior)

Greg Campbell, #18, Chaser: Newtown, Connecticut (Sophomore)

Andrew Garber, #7, Chaser: Rockville, Maryland (Sophomore)

Abbey Kaiser, #5, Chaser: Frederick, Maryland (Freshman)

Julia Fillman, #17, Chaser: Stroudsburg, Pennsylvania (Sophomore)

Tony Greco, #82, Keeper: Montvale, New Jersey (Sophomore)

Blaise Sceski, #88, Keeper: Oxford, Pennsylvaniva (Senior)

Sam Olson, #6, Keeper: Amity, Oregon (Junior)

Greg Habeeb, #11, Keeper: Bourne, Massachusetts (Freshman)

Prasanth Romiyo, #16, Chaser: Sewell, New Jersey (Freshman)

Carrie Franchino, #23, Chaser: Flemington, New Jersey (Freshman)

Khalil Taylor, #33, Chaser: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (Freshman)

Glennon Waters, #H20S, Chaser: San Diego, California (Freshman)

Joey Mazzola, #3, Chaser: East Williston, New York (Junior)

Billy Greco, #13, Seeker: Montvale, New Jersey (Senior)

Michelle Turner, #14, Beater: Park Ridge, New Jersey (Sophomore)

Jeff Chen, #91, Beater: Taipei, Taiwan (Junior)

Carmen Reynolds, #12, Beater: Houston, Texas (Freshman)

Kate Amuso, #32, Beater: Rochester, New York (Sophomore)

Matthew Barrett, #55, Beater: Belchertown, Massachusetts (Freshman)

Anthony Cerone, #15, Beater: Lawrenceville, New Jersey (Freshman)

Jillian Joyce, #22, Beater: Milford, New Hampshire (Junior)

Elena Gianella, #8, Beater: Wayne, Pennsylavnia (Sophomore)

Kelly Weaver, #25, Beater: Boston, Massachusetts (Sophomore)

 

 

 Tournament Results:

World Cup III (Fall 2009): Eliminated in the Quarterfinals by Boston University

Brothely Love Cup I: Champions

Vassar's Butterbeer Cup II: Champions

World Cup IV: Eliminated by Middlebury in Round of 16

World Cup V: Eliminated by Pitt in Round of 16

This Year:

Kite & Key Cup: Champions (3 teams)

Chestnut Hill Brotherly Love Cup: Champions (16 team)

Mid-Atlantic Regional Championship: Champions (20 teams)

 

Again, check out our tumblr! www.novaquidditch.tumblr.com

story:
Hi, We are having  a fundraiser for Tray Garabedian he has genetic Polycystic kidney disease and has stage 5 kidney failure. He has been on the Kidney transplant waiting list for a year at ECMC and is on dialysis 3 days a week. He has less than 5% of his kidneys functioning.

  We are trying to raise money to help with medical and monthly bills and the expensive anti-rejection medicine he will have to take for the rest of his life if he gets the transplant. and to possibly assist a potential donor if they need help while out of work while recovering from the surgery.Tray is disabled from this disease and is unable to work, the bills are mounting and unfortunatly until a donor is found he will remain ill and unable to provide for his family.

  Tray has had problems with his kidneys since 2002 when he had surgery to remove a kidney stone but he wasnt diagnosed with polycystic kidneys until 3 years ago. In the last 3 years his health declined from stage 4 kidney failure to stage 5. In november 2012 he was listed as disabled and tried to work for a couple more months until he was too sick to continue.

  In june of 2013 Tray suffered from another kidney stone and it could not be operated on due to the condition of his kidneys this caused his kidneys to drop to 5% function. He almost died but had emergency surgerys for AV Fistula and Catheter in his chest for dialysis. He has had 7 surgerys since june related to dialysis and goes 3 days a week for treatment.

  Tray is suffering from symptoms like pain,extreme fatigue,nausa,insomnia, and the dialysis treatments are also really rough on him.His sickness makes it hard to even grocery shop and he can barely leave the house anymore.

  Tray is A+ and has had several people get tested to see if they could donate but unfortunatly they were denied. He has a couple people currently being tested but still -no match yet. He also wants to raise awarness to kidney disease and how important it is for people to donate organs.  please sign your donor card and consider being a living donor for a kidney there are many people waiting for kidneys - YOU CAN SAVE A LIFE.

  If you are interested in being a donor or you have questions call Shelley Moran - Transplant coordinator at ECMC Hospital   716-898-6283

  Tray is a great guy who wants to be healthy so he can enjoy life with his daughter and family and friends. Please help us give this young man a second chance at life . THANK YOU

   You can donate $1 or $1,000,00.  any amount is greatly appreaciated you can also help by sharing this post

  Please check out the donation perks !!!!!!

 :::::: We are also trying to locate a kidney donor for a young local man who is O type blood, it doesnt matter if the O kidney he gets is positive or negative. actually any blood type is ok because it can be swapped for a closer match.

  There is no cost to the donor to get tested or for the operation. it is covered under insurance. the donor is also covered for life against kidney problems- if there was a kidney issue (which is rare due to extensive screening)

story:
Historic Downtown is a beautiful area of Brunswick, GA that is once again up-and-coming. There is a small grass roots group of creative people who really want to see this area thrive again, and I am one of them. There is a wonderful sense of community among the people here, and I would like to share my love of yoga with them.

A space has been located... I am a Certified Yoga Teacher. I began taking lessons years ago and have been teaching independently for 6 months. I would like a studio, a place where I welcome students and create a sense of family, where my students can share each other's energy and enthusiasm for yoga.

I began my teaching journey after watching my father pass away painfully from a physically debilitating disease. I know that if he had just taken more care of his body, in terms of movement and flexibility, much of his pain would not have been. Seeing him suffer motivated me to get my teacher certification so that I could help prevent others from suffering a similar fate.

I am ready to bring to the community of Brunswick a studio where they can learn to breathe, relax, stretch, and move. Some place that is not as intimidating as a gym, a place that offers a peaceful respite and an opportunity for mental and physical health and development.

I am asking for help to fund the opening costs of my studio. It is for the start up costs for things like advertising, yoga props, business licenses and business insurance. Your help is an immeasurable step toward my dream of bringing health and awareness to the people of Brunswick, and my gratitude for your assistance knows no bounds.

story:
What is Largesse?

Largesse (lar – jes) Noun: Gift • Freedom • Hope

Largesse  is a patent pending device that attaches to your smart phone and with the wave of your phone enables you to:

- capture important vital signs  which can be sent to your health care provider in real-time,

- remind you when to take your medication

- tracks your medication usage 

- refill prescriptions and  purchase other goods

Largesse removes the hassle of managing your health and gives you the freedom from time consuming tasks so that you have more time to do the things YOU want to DO.



 

 It has multiple functions all in one device.

 

 

Benefits

 Everyone Benefits

.

We Need Your Help

We have a prototype device that captures vital signs, tracks medication, and enables you to pay for prescription refills.  You have the power to help Blaze Mobile bring Largesse to market and to the general public so that the world can experience and take advantage of such a revolutionary medical device.  By donating you could also receive your Largesse sticker as a gift of appreciation.  

 

 

Rewards

For helping us out and millions of people who want to better manage their health, here are some of the rewards:

$10-Stay informed about Largesse and get up-to-date exclusive information

$50-Largesse and free app before it’s available in stores

$100-Largesse, free app before its available in stores, and  $25 towards any purchase using Largesse 

$200-Largesse, free app before it’s available in stores, and $50 towards any purchase using Largesse 

$500-Largesse, free app before it’s available in stores, and $75 towards any purchase using Largesse 

$1,000-Largesse, free app before its available in stores, $100 towards
any purchase using Largesse.

$2,000- 2 Largesse ‘s, free app before its available in stores,  $100 per Largesse  towards any purchase using Largesse, 2 free passes to  Digital Health Summit at CES in Las Vegas, 1/6/14-1/9/14  travel not included .

$4,000-4 Largesse ‘s, free app before its available in stores,  $100 per Largesse  towards any purchase using Largesse ,  4 free passes to  Digital Health Summit at CES in Las Vegas 1/6/14-1/9/14  travel not included.

$5,000-6 Largess’s, free app before its available in stores, $100  per Largesse  towards any purchase using Largesse ,6 free passes to  Digital Health Summit at CES in Las Vegas 1/6/14-1/9/14  travel not included.

$10,0000-1 Largesse  with, free customized app, $100  towards any purchase using Largesse  , 1 free pass  to  Digital Health Summit at CES in Las Vegas 1/6/14-1/9/14  travel not included ,  1hour session with Largesse  (aka “tricorder sticker “developer) and listed in  hall of fame.


Testimonials

"I love this idea. It’s really innovative. You guys have through  problems physicians and patients have." - Dr. Olajide Williams, MD 

 

"For Patients that have to take 7-10 medications a day, Largesse is revolutionary"- Dr. David Parpart, MD

 

"Largesse turns your smart phone into a tricorder"-Dr. Ian Anwah, MD.

 

"Since Largesse scans patient data and makes it immediately available it - not only puts the power in the hands of the patient - it enables physicians to use it as a tool to remind patients to take their medications." - Dr. Olajide Williams, MD

.

FAQ

1) How does the Largesse  help me track my medications?

First, open the Largesse application on your smartphone. Second, affix the Largesse to your smartphone. Third, apply the Largesse  labels to your medicine bottles. Now you simply hold Largesse near the prescription label. The Largesse application on
your smartphone will enable you to get more information about your medication
like doctor or pharmacist instructions. It will also automatically log
information when you take your medication including the date, time, and dosage

2) How does the Largesse help me refill prescriptions and pay for other
products?

Simply hold the Largesse near the point-of-sale terminal where you check out. This is the same machine that you swipe your credit or debit card through, so you’ve seen and used it thousands of times already. Note that Largesse must
be registered and activated in order to make purchases.

Here is a vides that shows how payments works https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fymoJAdvlWM&amp...

 

3) Which phones does the Largesse  work with?

Largesse works with Apple and Android smartphones, 

 

4) What about my privacy? 

None of the information that you provide is given to any 3rd parties, and it never will be. We completely respect your privacy and your faith in us. We absolutely promise not to share any bit of your information.

 

5) Is this secure? What if my cell phone is lost or stolen?

Yes, your data is safe even if your phone is lost or stolen. None of your data is stored on the phone. Therefore, there is no data for anyone to steal or find on your phone. Furthermore, your data is encrypted while it is being sent and received by your Largesse . You have the ability to require a PIN be entered before enabling a purchase for added security.  .
